channel.title: Benchsci Job Postings
channel.description: Job postings for Benchsci from lever.co

item.title: Workplace Operations Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Our Operations teams anticipate and plan for anything that is thrown our way with dedication, flexibility, transparency, and professionalism. We find order in chaos, and we thrive when faced with new and challenging problems, no matter how big or small. We excel at keeping our cool while doing what needs to be done, often under tight deadlines. Our team strives to make the impossible happen on a daily basis by delivering on numerous projects faster than most companies even know where to begin.

item.title: Workday Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Workday Engineer on our People Systems team, you will be responsible for maintenance of Workday as well as supporting testing and implementing Workday HCM solutions. Relevant HRIS admin experience in Workday coupled with strong communication and prioritization skills will enable you to support internal teams with their Workday needs. You are able to navigate Workday freely and stay on top of day to day maintenance and data integrity requirements, along with supporting workflows such as audits, adanced reporting, alerts/notifications, user troubleshooting and BP configuration work.
You will act as an important partner to Information Technology (IT), Business Owners and individual Palantirians. You will be familiar with working in an environment with tickets, project plans and weekly scrums, and will be able to anticipate the needs of our internal partners to ensure your outcomes meet the most critical business priorities. Most importantly, you find systems work exciting and rewarding, and enjoy contributing as a key member of the People Systems Team.

item.title: Workday Architect
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Workday Architect on the HR Tools team, you will be responsible for identifying, designing, and implementing Workday HCM solutions alongside oversight of the general health of the system while considering the long term vision of the product and organizational needs.
You will serve as an important partner to Internal teams, product managers, and the People team. You can track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate the needs of internal partners to ensure your outcomes meet the most critical business priorities.

item.title: Web Engineer, Front End
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Front-end Web Engineer, you’ll be a member of our Mission Operations Team, partnering closely with Palantir leadership and our Sales & Marketing teams to create and deploy palantir.com. We seek to build a complex and dynamic web presence for Palantir that meets our security requirements. We're looking for someone with a passion for creating a beautiful user experience with pixel-perfect attention to detail. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with multiple content development and marketing agencies around the world to internationalize our web presence and build our global brand.

item.title: Technical Writer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a technical writer and editor, you’ll play a key role in helping our customers succeed by creating, maintaining, and improving documentation that supports users of Palantir’s products.
At Palantir, we view documentation as a key part of product development. Working at the intersection of users and Palantir’s products, you will develop an understanding of user needs and help them get the most out of our software. You’ll be a thought partner with our product development teams, combining your communication skills with empathy for users and product knowledge. Your work will primarily be on written documentation, but may also include interactive tutorials, recorded demonstrations, or other communication channels.
Teams and individuals at Palantir operate with a high degree of autonomy and independence. In this role, you’ll be responsible for setting priorities for your work, deciding where to allocate your time based on an assessment of stakeholder and organizational needs. You should be comfortable thinking about the “big picture” narrative and structure of our documentation, as well as diving into the details. On any given day, you might find yourself editing a guide drafted by a developer, writing a new tutorial for a critical workflow, or identifying an area that needs improvement and partnering with a team to make the fix. You will also gain exposure to the technical infrastructure for composing and distributing platform documentation.

item.title: Technical Sourcer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Technical Sourcer, you will work closely with Recruiters and Hiring Managers to identify and engage exceptional talent to augment our candidate pipelines. We’re looking for someone who is resourceful, creative, performance-oriented, and a researcher at heart. This role will rely heavily on your ability to creatively uncover talent for some of our most hard-to-fill roles at Palantir. You will collaborate cross-functionally with our Recruiting team, focusing on our University efforts. Projects excite you and you think critically about problem-solving. You are a brilliant communicator, you understand technology, and you enjoy the continuous search for talent.

item.title: Technical Recruiter
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Recruiter at Palantir, you will directly impact the company's future by identifying and attracting excellent candidates for our organization. The role will constantly challenge you to think creatively about how to drive hiring results and will require you to be part of a team that is responsible for developing, implementing, and executing a broad recruiting strategy. The ability to identify and source high quality candidates and be responsible for landing them on the appropriate team is critical in this role. Finally, you will own Recruiting partnerships and guide stakeholders through the entire hiring process - dealing with a variety of nuanced situations along the way.

item.title: Technical Program Manager (TPM)
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Technical Program Manager (TPM) deployed to one of our product development teams (Gotham and Foundry), you are the engine behind Palantir’s engineering teams. You partner with developers to optimize our development process and make sure we’re shipping high quality products every day. You track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate stakeholder needs to free up our engineers to focus their time and attention on the technical problems they are best equipped to solve.
This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, technical aptitude and execution skills. You are a person who loves fixing problems and always embraces the best idea, even when it is not your own.

As a Technical Program Manager (TPM) deployed to one of our product development teams (Gotham and Foundry), you are the engine behind Palantir’s engineering teams. You partner with developers to optimize our development process and make sure we’re shipping high quality products every day. You track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate stakeholder needs to free up our engineers to focus their time and attention on the technical problems they are best equipped to solve.
This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, technical aptitude and execution skills. You are a person who loves fixing problems and always embraces the best idea, even when it is not your own.

item.title: Technical Account Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Around the world, data is being generated at an exponential rate. Many government agencies and commercial institutions worldwide have made investments in data platforms but still struggle to make data-driven decision-making a reality at the scale of their business. Palantir’s software helps these organizations transform data and models into operational assets, empowering them to solve their most critical problems. As Technical Account Manager (TAM) you will be responsible for ensuring that our customers extract the maximum benefit from Palantir Foundry. This is a senior and key role for ensuring customer success with Palantir Foundry and a strong lasting relationship with Palantir.
As a part of the Sales organization you will play a pivotal role in ensuring sustainable results from Sales to Delivery. You will have a direct role in defining the strategy, architecture and technical solutions that allow some of the leading world organizations to use data to solve real-world problems. Customer focused, you will understand their business strategy and challenges, and their unique technical landscape as it evolves and act as a trusted advisor to enhance business benefits. You will collaborate with the customer and Palantir engagement organizations to maximize how Palantir Foundry accelerates the customer strategy and secures their return on investments.

item.title: Systems Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Systems Team owns critical infrastructure that enable Palantirians to run applications and services crucial to their work. As an engineer on this team, you will focus on applying modern technology to deploy, monitor, and maintain systems across a variety of on-premise and cloud platforms. On any given day, you could be finding ways to programmatically manage complex systems with code, working with other internal teams to make sure their services are highly available, or working with Information Security to harden critical systems.

item.title: Support Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Support Specialist, you will be joining an outstanding Technical Support team. You will provide front line support that focuses on in office, email and chat support worldwide. Effective troubleshooting and the ability to find solutions quickly will be foundational to your role. Your ability to own problems from end to end and work to root-cause will be key to your success. You’re someone whose curiosity drives them to learn new technologies quickly and supports their peers through complex issues. You are a person that loves fixing problems and gains fulfillment in helping others solve their technology challenges no matter how small or unique.

item.title: Subcontracts Administrator (U.S. Federal)
item.description:
Washington, DC region required but open to excellent candidates looking for a hybrid office/work from home schedule.
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us!
The Role
Palantir is seeking a Subcontracts Administrator to join our broader U.S. Federal contracts and legal team, which is key to Palantir’s mission. We’re a team that values creativity and teamwork. Whether operating solo or collaboratively, our goal is to enable our U.S. government agency customers and partner collaborators to unlock their data and power critical operations.
In this role, you’ll provide strategic support for business-to-business relationships throughout our supply chain, including negotiating and managing subcontracts, non-disclosure agreements (NDAs), teaming agreements, and memoranda of understanding. You’ll be the primary point of contact for communications with our subcontractors and other partners, and also drive communications with internal teams like program management, finance, and technical compliance, in order to negotiate and sign agreements with our business partners. You’ll manage agreements and workflows that are critical to our U.S. Federal work, including vendor and supplier contracts, programs with strategic partners, and subcontractor deliverables.

item.title: Software Engineer, New Grad
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Software Engineers at Palantir build software at scale to transform how organizations around the world use data. As a Software Engineer you’ll have an opportunity to grow more quickly than you ever envisioned, as you contribute high-quality code directly to Palantir Gotham, Palantir Apollo, or Palantir Foundry: products that are deployed at some of the most important institutions across the public and private sectors. You'll create features used by research scientists, aerospace engineers, intelligence analysts, and economic forecasters, in countries around the world. Palantir's Product Development organization is made up of small teams of Software Engineers, each focusing on a specific aspect of a product. For example, you might join a team that builds a Foundry front-end application, or a component of the Gotham release infrastructure. We encourage communication and collaboration among teams to share context, skills, and experience, so you'll learn about many different aspects of each product.
As a Software Engineer, you are involved throughout the product lifecycle - from idea generation, design, and prototyping to execution and shipping while also being paired with a mentor dedicated to your growth and success. You'll collaborate closely with technical and non-technical counterparts to understand our customers' problems and build products that tackle them. One of the most effective ways to understand what our users need is to meet them. You may receive an opportunity to tour the assembly line at an auto-manufacturer or join a counter-terror analyst at their desk to really understand their mission and difficulties.
SWE principles include:
• Ownership: We see projects through from beginning to end in spite of obstacles we may encounter. • Collaboration: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds — such as other Software Engineers, Product Managers, Designers and Product Reliability Engineers. We also partner with our business development teams (Forward Deployed Engineers, Deployment Strategists) in order to understand and solve our customers' problems. • Trust: We trust each other to effectively handle time and priorities, and don't micromanage. We want people to have the space to think for themselves, while feeling supported by their team.
Technologies We Use
It doesn’t matter what languages you know when you join us, but it does matter that you can write clean, effective code and learn new languages quickly. Our software is constantly evolving, so we need engineers who can do the same. Alongside peers that bring diverse experience - whether you’re a former university TA, switched to CS recently, or are a hackathon enthusiast — you'll build your skills to apply the best technology to solve a given problem. Right now, we use:
• A variety of languages, including Java and Go for backend and Typescript for frontend • Open-source technologies like Cassandra, Spark, Elasticsearch, React, and Redux • Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, and Github

• A variety of languages, including Java and Go for backend and Typescript for frontend • Open-source technologies like Cassandra, Spark, Elasticsearch, React, and Redux • Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, and Github

item.title: Software Engineer, New Grad
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Software Engineers at Palantir build software at scale to transform how organizations around the world use data. As a Software Engineer you’ll have an opportunity to grow more quickly than you ever envisioned, as you contribute high-quality code directly to Palantir Gotham, Palantir Apollo, or Palantir Foundry: products that are deployed at some of the most important institutions across the public and private sectors. You'll create features used by research scientists, aerospace engineers, intelligence analysts, and economic forecasters, in countries around the world. Palantir's Product Development organization is made up of small teams of Software Engineers, each focusing on a specific aspect of a product. For example, you might join a team that builds a Foundry front-end application, or a component of the Gotham release infrastructure. We encourage communication and collaboration among teams to share context, skills, and experience, so you'll learn about many different aspects of each product.
As a Software Engineer, you are involved throughout the product lifecycle - from idea generation, design, and prototyping to execution and shipping while also being paired with a mentor dedicated to your growth and success. You'll collaborate closely with technical and non-technical counterparts to understand our customers' problems and build products that tackle them. One of the most effective ways to understand what our users need is to meet them. You may receive an opportunity to tour the assembly line at an auto-manufacturer or join a counter-terror analyst at their desk to really understand their mission and difficulties.
SWE principles include:
• Ownership: We see projects through from beginning to end in spite of obstacles we may encounter. • Collaboration: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds — such as other Software Engineers, Product Managers, Designers and Product Reliability Engineers. We also partner with our business development teams (Forward Deployed Engineers, Deployment Strategists) in order to understand and solve our customers' problems. • Trust: We trust each other to effectively handle time and priorities, and don't micromanage. We want people to have the space to think for themselves, while feeling supported by their team.
Technologies We Use
It doesn’t matter what languages you know when you join us, but it does matter that you can write clean, effective code and learn new languages quickly. Our software is constantly evolving, so we need engineers who can do the same. Alongside peers that bring diverse experience - whether you’re a former university TA, switched to CS recently, or are a hackathon enthusiast — you'll build your skills to apply the best technology to solve a given problem. Right now, we use:
• A variety of languages, including Java and Go for backend and Typescript for frontend • Open-source technologies like Cassandra, Spark, Elasticsearch, React, and Redux • Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, and Github

item.title: Software Engineer, Infrastructure
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Production Infrastructure team's goal is to accelerate the end-to-end engineering lifecycle at Palantir by building tools and platforms that make it easier to create, deploy, and iterate on secure and highly available software. As a Software Engineer on the Production Infrastructure team, you will reimagine how our company builds and deploys software and how we use data to make decisions, then build the products and infrastructure to enable that new approach.

item.title: Software Engineer, Core Infrastructure
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The role
The Core Infrastructure team is responsible for all of our Kubernetes production environments — from on-prem to cloud, connected or disconnected, small footprint or large. We help support Palantir’s mission by enabling our software to run where it is needed most - no matter the challenges.
As a software engineer on the core infrastructure team you get to design and build Palantir’s managed Kubernetes product offerings across all hosting environments. You will be responsible for building industry leading tooling that enables a highly-independent, specialized team to operate and evolve hundreds of Kubernetes clusters across these environments (public clouds, restricted/private clouds, on-premise, small hardware footprint environments). We highly value operational and engineering excellence, striving to build tech that not only unlocks the future of infrastructure for Palantir, but doing it with minimal operational overhead. If you’re excited about infrastructure at scale and working with Kubernetes, this is the right role for you.
Please note that this posting is open to all levels of experience.

item.title: Software Engineer, Apollo Platform
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Are you excited about building world class platforms that power mission critical software at a huge scale? Apollo enables autonomous management and continuous deployment of software, wherever it is. We’re taking SAAS to where SAAS has not gone before: from on-premise, to various cloud providers, to disconnected environments (air-gapped), to strict accreditation frameworks including IL-5 and FedRAMP, and to the edge. You can read more about the problem Apollo was built to solve on our blog or watch our Apollo demo day.
As a Software Engineer on the Apollo platform you will build software at scale to transform how organizations around the world deploy software. You will be responsible for mission critical software powering deployment of software for both Palantir and its customers in the commercial and government space.
You have a curious mind, high bar for engineering quality and ability to work in a dynamic environment where the best idea wins. Apollo Software Engineers are involved throughout the product lifecycle. From idea generation, to design and prototyping, to execution, and shipping. As a Software Engineer, you'll collaborate closely with technical and non-technical counterparts to understand our customers' problems and build products that solve them.
Please note that this posting is open to all levels of experience.

Our products support some of the most important and impactful work in the world, including defense, intelligence, and commercial applications. We are trusted by our customers to protect their mission-critical information in the face of advanced persistent threats. The mission of the Security Infrastructure team is to build platforms and software to enable our products and teams to provide the highest level of assurance to our customers. This role has wide-reaching impact, strong autonomy, and the resources and empowerment to make significant security improvements across all Palantir. The skills and background of successful candidates may vary highly, but curiosity, tenacity, and a drive to be an extraordinary security engineer are the underpinnings of our team.
As a Software Engineer on our Security Infrastructure team, you will be hands-on and have wide-ranging impact for the security of Palantir and its customers. You will be responsible for:
Data Engineering: You will develop the data and telemetry pipeline and backing cluster that collects and ingests terabytes of data per hour into a multi-petabyte data warehouse that powers our observability systems.
Counter-Abuse Technologies: You will develop technologies to refine the fraud and abuse defenses in our products.

item.title: Software Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Software Engineers at Palantir build software at scale to transform how organizations around the world use data. As a Software Engineer, you'll contribute high-quality code to Palantir Gotham or Palantir Foundry: products that are deployed to the most important institutions in the public and private sector. You'll build features used by research scientists, aerospace engineers, intelligence analysts, and economic forecasters, in countries around the world.
Palantir's Product Development organization is made up of small teams of Software Engineers. Each team focuses on a specific aspect of a product: for example, you might be part of a team that builds a Foundry front-end application, or a component of the Gotham release infrastructure. We encourage movement among teams to share context, skills, and experience, so you'll learn about many different aspects of each product.
Software Engineers are involved throughout the product lifecycle, from idea generation, design, and prototyping to execution, and shipping. As a Software Engineer, you'll collaborate closely with technical and non-technical counterparts to understand our customers' problems and build products that solve them. We think the best way to understand what our users need is to meet them, so occasionally, you'll tour the assembly line at an auto manufacturer or join a counter-terror analyst at their desk to really understand their mission and their pain points.
It doesn’t matter what languages you know when you join us, but it does matter that you can write clean, effective code and learn new languages quickly. Our software is constantly evolving, so we need engineers who can do the same. Alongside peers who bring diverse experience — startup founders, industry veterans, university TAs, and more — you'll build your skillset to apply the best technology to solve a given problem. Right now, we use:
• A variety of languages, including Java and Go for back end and Typescript for front end • Open-source technologies like Cassandra, Spark, ElasticSearch, React, and Redux • Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, and Github
Whether you aspire to be an entrepreneur or an engineering leader, we believe Palantir is the best place — with the best colleagues — to learn how. You’ll learn how to unpack a problem and understand the costs and consequences of its solution. You’ll learn new technologies and languages, and even develop them yourself. You’ll work autonomously and make decisions independently, within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow and develop.

item.title: Site Reliability Operations Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Site Reliability Operations Analyst you are the engine behind Palantir deployments. You are responsible for crafting, implementing and executing processes to streamline workflows and reduce friction. You track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate customer needs to free up our engineers to focus their time and attention on the technical problems they are best equipped to solve.
This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, and execution skills. You are a person who loves fixing problems and always embraces the best idea, even when it is not your own.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We’re looking for Site Reliability Engineers who can help us build, operate, and maintain high-performance, scalable, and reliable services for our production infrastructure. Site Reliability Engineers combine engineering experience and an innate drive to improve existing systems and processes, with the creativity to develop novel solutions to evolving challenges. Our team strives to automate processes wherever possible, using whichever tools are best for the job.
We strongly believe in engineering teams being responsible for the operations of their services in production. In this role, you’ll work closely with engineers to advocate and participate in sensible, scalable, systems design and share responsibility with them in diagnosing, resolving, and preventing production issues.

item.title: Senior Treasury Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We are looking for an experienced treasury professional to join our team in Palo Alto, California. As part of our growing team, you’ll have a high level of involvement and ownership in liquidity management, banking relationships, global account structures, cash forecasting, and building best practices across the Treasury and Finance team. As a Senior Treasury Analyst, you will support all aspects of Treasury Operations activities. This includes assisting with the development of cash management banking solutions for all business segments of the company and support the cash forecasting process. You will identify, develop, and implement innovative solutions using your extensive knowledge of financial products and intuitive problem-solving abilities.
The Treasury team is just one component of a dynamic Finance team. Although Treasury will be your primary focus, you will have immediate interaction and opportunities across the Finance team including accounting, tax, payroll, and financial operations. As a team, we are collaborative, iterative, fun, hard-working, solutions-based, and strive to build systems, analytics and processes that scale with Palantir.

item.title: Senior Travel and Expense Operations Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Senior Travel & Expense Operations Analyst, you'll join a team responsible for streamlining our systems and processes to align with our expanding global business footprint. You’ll help manage our expense system (Concur), global corporate card programs, day to-day expense reporting and auditing operations, and business communications and education. You’ll need to be able to push forward multiple priorities, balance business needs with finance requirements, and have fantastic customer service.

item.title: Senior Director - Global Alliances - Defense Technology
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir’s Alliances is a central pillar of our growth engine. The Alliances team builds and manages Palantir’s key partnerships with Global SI’s, Hyperscalers and ISV’s. We are looking for a senior leader who thrives in a fast paced environment and will play an integral role in building a team responsible for our relationships.
Our ideal candidate will have significant experience operating at the senior executive levels and have an in-depth familiarity with business models for defense contractors. Strong awareness is a must, with the ability to translate how Palantir’s software platform can enable these companies’ go-to-market service offerings. Specific companies are: Lockheed, L3, Booz & a select group of small government services companies.

item.title: Senior Corporate Accounting Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Senior Accounting Analyst at Palantir you’ll work to drive improvements and quality initiatives across our growing Accounting & Finance organization, supporting senior accounting leadership with strategies that prioritize scalability and value creation.
In this role, you’ll create immediate impact, getting deep into cross functional work and identifying areas for improvement. You will be responsible for helping the Corporate Accounting team close the books monthly, as well as building out related internal controls, automation and process enhancements.
You are a problem solver, who's not satisfied with the status quo, and is energized by opportunities to improve efficiency and accuracy of existing processes.

The Role

You will help us understand the human terrain with customers, as well as provide insights on the budgets, priorities, and upcoming pipeline of programs. This role will support both existing contracts, as well as new growth efforts with our DoD sales team.

item.title: Senior Accounts Payable Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Finance Team supports and empowers Palantirians through both day-to-day operations and creative problem-solving. As a member of the Accounts Payable Team, you'll be providing the key input we need to stay ahead of our vendor payables. In the Sr. Accounts Payable Specialist role, organization and attention to detail are paramount - the business relies on you so they can build the infrastructure they need to be successful, and the Finance team depends on you for inputs into our financials and various modelings.

item.title: Securities Counsel
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As Securities Counsel, you’ll join Palantir’s in-house legal team as the legal backbone of our corporate and securities team. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual keen to join a team that cultivates Palantir's equity philosophy, connects with folks across the Palantir community, and sees itself as key to Palantir’s mission.
As a specialist, you will help advise and work on a variety of corporate and securities issues and transactions, while interacting directly (and frequently!) with our Chief Legal and Business Affairs Officer, Chief Financial Officer, and company leadership. You will work closely with our finance and stock administration teams on equity matters and administration. You will take on novel, complex issues as they arise, and bring multi-stepped projects to completion. You will also be a key contributor to the legal team and to the company as a whole, with the opportunity to work on a wide array of legal matters, including negotiating commercial agreements with Fortune 50 companies and working on regulatory, intellectual property, employment, and international issues.

item.title: Salesforce Administrator
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Around the world, data is being generated at an exponential rate, and many government agencies and commercial institutions worldwide are ill-equipped to handle data at scale. Palantir’s software helps these organizations build data assets that enables efficient analysis and more effective management of their data, empowering them to solve their most critical problems.
The Revenue Technical (RevTech) team equips and supports Palantir’s Sales and Marketing functions to meet their objectives. Equipped with a deep knowledge of Salesforce, as the Salesforce Administrator you’ll focus on the overall support and maintenance of Palantir’s Salesforce instances, including (but not limited to) design and development, integration, testing, and regular platform maintenance. As part of that support, you will have the opportunity to collaborate across our internal support teams, as well as with business partners.

item.title: Sales Recruiter
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Sales Recruiter at Palantir, you will directly scale Palantir’s business and impact by identifying and attracting top talent for our Sales organization. The role will constantly challenge you to think creatively about how to drive and meet hiring results. You will partner with vendors and be responsible for directing and executing a global recruiting strategy. You’ll also own Recruiting partnerships and guide stakeholders through the entire hiring process - navigating a variety of nuanced situations along the way.

item.title: Sales Program Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Sales Program Manager, you are the operational engine behind Palantir’s Sales teams. You will be responsible for crafting, implementing, and executing sales processes to streamline workflows and reduce friction across the business. You’re a creative thinker and operational executor with strong interpersonal skills who can partner with stakeholders across the company to track and stabilize projects, anticipate needs, and remove roadblocks. Your creative approach to project management centers around frameworks that enable rapid iteration, while operating in harmony with the team’s vision and evolving needs.
In this role, you’ll leverage your background in sales operations and deploy Palantir’s products to create, automate, and scale our sales workflows. This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, and execution skills, in addition to a comprehensive knowledge of sales workflows, tooling, and reporting systems. You are a person who loves fixing problems and always embraces the best idea, even when it is not your own.

item.title: Sales Enablement Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We're looking for a Sales Enablement Specialist to build and execute a Sales Enablement strategy to help us convert more opportunities. You will join our rapidly growing sales and marketing team, focused on winning business across our global sales teams. You'll play a diverse set of roles, from developing sales enablement content yourself, to defining sales enablement strategy and working alongside our demand generation, sales, marketing and leadership functions.

item.title: Sales - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Around the world, data is being generated at an exponential rate, and many government agencies and commercial institutions worldwide are ill-equipped to handle data at scale. Palantir’s software helps these organizations build data assets that enables efficient analysis and more effective management of their data, empowering them to solve their most critical problems.
The Sales Team is responsible for getting Palantir’s software to these organizations. Sales Reps find, evaluate, and pursue new business opportunities for a targeted institution or geography, seeking partners whose missions, objectives, and values align with our own. Each institution is different and each country has its own way of procuring software, and Sales Reps see these distinctions as opportunities — for creative thinking, diligent research, and value creation. Successful Sales Reps tailor their approach to Palantir and to each unique opportunity, rather than relying on past strategies for selling other enterprise software.
Armed with a deep knowledge of the product and its real-world applicability, Sales Reps cultivate existing relationships and work diligently to build new ones. Motivated by the knowledge that the software they sell is directly responsible for uncovering fraud, stopping wrongdoing, and saving lives, Sales Reps exceed ambitious sales quotas and come up with new targets.

Successful Sales Reps tailor their approach to Palantir and to each unique opportunity, rather than relying on past strategies for selling other enterprise software.
Armed with a deep knowledge of the product and its real-world applicability, Sales Reps cultivate existing relationships and work diligently to build new ones. Motivated by the knowledge that the software they sell is directly responsible for uncovering fraud, stopping wrongdoing, and saving lives, Sales Reps exceed ambitious sales quotas and come up with new targets.

item.title: Risk and Compliance Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir is seeking a Risk & Compliance Specialist to provide critical support in the design, development and maintenance of our risk program. As part of the Legal Compliance team, you will partner closely with our partners around the organization (including Legal, Finance, Product, and Business Development) to identify and mitigate potential compliance risks to the company. We are a team that values creativity and teamwork. Whether operating solo or collaboratively, we endeavor to achieve great results on challenging projects.
Palantir’s Compliance team operates at the junction of our business operations and regulatory obligations, helping build our business responsibly in a complex and dynamic environment of overlapping obligations around the world. Our ideal candidate for this role is energized by these challenges, and adept at analyzing real-world business and operational data for the purposes of identifying and surfacing compliance risks for mitigation. To succeed in this role, you must be comfortable navigating both a fast-paced business environment and a complex international web of regulatory regimes. You must truly enjoy assisting and taking ownership of a wide range of projects. Your work will provide valuable impact in supporting a culture of compliance which helps us solve some of the world’s hardest and most impactful problems.

item.title: Risk and Compliance Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir is seeking a Risk & Compliance Specialist to provide critical support in the design, development and maintenance of our third-party risk program. As part of the Legal Compliance team, you will partner closely with our partners around the organization (including Legal, Finance, Product, and Business Development) to identify and mitigate potential compliance risks to the company. We are a team that values creativity and partnership. Whether operating solo or collaboratively, we seek to achieve great results on exciting projects.
Palantir’s Compliance team operates at the junction of our business operations and regulatory obligations, helping build our business responsibly in a complex and dynamic environment of overlapping obligations around the world. Our ideal candidate for this role is motivated by these challenges, and adept at analyzing real-world business and operational data for the purposes of identifying and surfacing compliance risks for mitigation. To succeed in this role, you are able to navigate both a fast-paced business environment and a sophisticated international web of regulatory regimes. You are passionate about owning and completing a wide range of projects. Your work will provide valuable impact in supporting a culture of compliance which helps us solve some of the world’s hardest and most impactful problems.

item.title: Risk and Compliance Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a member of Palantir's Technical Compliance team, you will develop a deep understanding of Palantir's control environment, infrastructure, and products. You will work with engineers, security, clients, and auditors to navigate and manage compliance frameworks (e.g., ISO/SOC/NIST) in order to provide practical guidance on technical documentation, operational concerns, and sustainable processes that will allow us to continue to grow quickly & efficiently while also maintaining our current compliance obligations.
We are looking for a technically experienced and innovative security, compliance, and audit professional that understands IT processes, has strong communications skills, and can manage complex cross organizational projects.

item.title: Regulatory Attorney - (International)
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us!
The Role
Palantir is seeking a Regulatory Counsel to join our Compliance function within the Legal Team in the UK. Our team’s mission is to proactively provide compliance advice to the business, in an effort to support Palantir’s responsible business growth. In this role, you’ll be supporting teams across the business as they navigate various regulatory requirements. You will play an integral part in strategically developing our compliance program in a constantly shifting landscape, so that Palantir achieves its goals.
We’re a team that values both creativity and teamwork - whether operating solo or collaboratively. Delivering complex information using strong communication and interpersonal skills will aid you in achieving team wins. You'll have the opportunity to work on complex, time-sensitive projects. Our ideal candidate enjoys being innovative when solving problems, whilst drawing on strong analytical reasoning to recommend appropriate solutions. Although this role is focused on international regulatory compliance and ethics, you should have a flexible altitude to assist with the changing needs of the business.

item.title: Recruiting Project and Operations Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Recruiting Project and Operations Manager, you are the operational engine behind Palantir’s Recruiting team. You will be responsible for building and implementing processes to streamline recruiting team workflows and scaling new initiatives. You’ll partner with recruiting leadership to track and stabilize projects, anticipate needs, and remove roadblocks to enable the recruiting team to focus on their hiring goals. This will require you to be both a strategic partner, as well as someone who enjoys getting into the weeds. Lastly, our ideal candidate is passionate about recruiting and excited to play a vital role in scaling hiring at Palantir.

item.title: Recruiting Coordinator
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Recruiting Coordinator at Palantir, you will work closely with our hiring managers and recruiters to ensure a positive interview experience for all candidates. We’re looking for someone who is smart, resourceful, and who thrives under intense pressure. This position will rely heavily on your superb ability to manage multiple and competing priorities in a hectic environment. You will be part of a team that is responsible for developing, implementing, and executing on a broad recruiting strategy, with an emphasis on efficiency and overall value generation (i.e. hiring awesome people!).

item.title: Quality Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir Quality Engineers work on cross-functional development teams to ensure a successful, high-quality product release. We are looking for highly motivated and detail-oriented engineers to fill this role. As a Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for creating end-to-end test plans based both on expected uses and functional requirements; validating functionality; finding, filing, verifying, and debugging issues; and providing extensive input on the software development process, with a particular focus on the user perspective. Quality Engineers work with Product Designers, Software Engineers, and Forward Deployed Engineers at each stage of development and deployment to ensure a consistent, intuitive, and functional user experience.

item.title: Proposal Writer and Strategist - US Defense
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Proposal Writer and Strategist you stand at the heart of Palantir Technologies' Defense capture and procurement process. Curious, critically-minded, and detail-oriented, you are a strong writer, capable of turning complex technical concepts into persuasive proposals, white papers, project vision statements, and other business documents. On any given day, you are writing detailed explanations of our software's capabilities, scouring U.S. procurement websites and analyzing budgets for potential business opportunities, managing formal proposals for new contracts, and crafting procurement strategies in highly competitive markets. You are excited to draft technical and non-technical content for customer-facing documents and to collaborate with key members of our engineering, legal, sales, and leadership teams.
This role is an opportunity to embed deeply in a unique company. Palantir is fast-paced, and you'll be expected to make decisions independently by weighing many needs and priorities. The role and its surrounding organization aren't rigidly deﬁned, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment. In this role, you'll wear many hats, arising to new business challenges while growing your skills on the job. We are looking for mission-driven teammates who can jump into any writing project with enthusiasm.

item.title: Proposal Writer and Strategist - US Commercial, New Grad
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Proposal Writer and Strategist, you will be a central part of Palantir’s commercial business development team. In collaboration with business development, legal, and product developers you will write and manage compelling proposals that win new business with U.S. Commercial organizations. On any given day, we’re managing a formal proposal for a new contract, triaging several new business opportunities, or writing a description of Palantir’s work and impact at a Fortune 500 company.
This role is an opportunity to embed deeply in Palantir’s business development team and learn about how our software meets critical needs within dozens of different industries. Palantir is fast-paced, and you'll be expected to make decisions independently by weighing many needs and priorities. The role and its surrounding organization aren't rigidly deﬁned, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment. You’ll leverage your skills in writing, research, design, and project management to put together compelling documents, collaborate with teams across the company, and help shape strategy for U.S. Commercial outreach. We are looking for team members who can own business development projects from end to end and are willing to get their hands dirty — from writing a detailed proposal submission, to ideating a white paper, to preparing a slide deck for a key external meeting — with enthusiasm.

item.title: Proposal and Capture Strategist, Palantir Apollo - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Capture and Proposal Strategists are a central part of Government and Commercial Business Development teams at Palantir. In this role, you will work in collaboration with the US Government Palantir Apollo team with both business development and technical leadership in support of the launch and expansion of Palantir Apollo in the Federal market. You will support and execute strategy for new customer acquisition and write compelling content that influences and wins contracts. On any given day, you’ll be managing a formal proposal for a new contract, drafting market research to help inform prospective clients, identifying and triaging new business opportunities, or researching contract and capture opportunities in partnership with business development and technical teams.
In this role, you will collaborate with a team, while also making decisions independently and balancing competing priorities across multiple account teams within Palantir’s US Government business. You will wear many hats and operate in a dynamic work environment. You’ll leverage your problem solving expertise, ability to learn quickly, writing, and communication skills to navigate unique business challenges and create innovative solutions. We are looking for mission-driven teammates who can own any business development project — from preparing for external meetings, to ideating and drafting a white paper, to a detailed proposal submission — with enthusiasm.
You strive to be the best at what you do and can work efficiently in any environment. You'll collaborate with engineers to translate highly technical and complex concepts into clear, concise, and powerful written products. It would help to have a more technical background yourself, but it's not required if you can learn technical concepts quickly. You'll prepare documents that effectively communicate the features and benefits of Palantir Apollo. You'll write, edit, and rewrite technical and non-technical text in order to put forward the most compelling proposals and customer deliverables. You'll work with teams across the broader company as we launch Palantir Apollo in the commercial marketplace.

You'll prepare documents that effectively communicate the features and benefits of Palantir's products. You'll write, edit, and rewrite technical and non-technical text in order to put forward the most compelling proposals and customer deliverables.

item.title: Proposal and Capture Strategist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, help combat the COVID-19 pandemic, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Capture and Proposal Strategists are a central part of Government and Commercial Business Development teams at Palantir. In collaboration with business development and technical execution stakeholders, you will expand Palantir’s footprint in the U.S. Government by developing and executing strategy for new customer acquisition and writing compelling proposals and market research documents that influence and win contracts. On any given day, we’re managing a formal proposal for a new contract, drafting market research to help inform procurement processes, identifying and triaging new business opportunities, or researching contract and capture opportunities in partnership with Sales, technical, and other Business Development teams.
In this role, you will collaborate with a team, while also making decisions independently and balancing competing priorities across multiple agencies. You will wear many hats and operate in a dynamic work environment. You’ll leverage your problem solving expertise, ability to learn quickly, writing, and communication skills to navigate unique business challenges and create innovative solutions. We are looking for mission-driven teammates who can own any business development project — from preparing for external meetings, to ideating and drafting a white paper, to a detailed proposal submission — with enthusiasm.
You strive to be the best at what you do and can work efficiently in any environment. You'll collaborate with engineers to translate highly technical and complex concepts into clear, concise, and powerful written products. You'll prepare documents that effectively communicate the features and benefits of Palantir's products. You'll write, edit, and rewrite technical and non-technical text in order to put forward the most compelling proposals and customer deliverables.

item.title: Production Engineer - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We’re looking for Production Engineers who can help us build, operate, and maintain high-performance, scalable, and reliable services for our production infrastructure. Production Engineers combine engineering experience and an innate drive to improve existing systems and processes, with the creativity to develop novel solutions to evolving challenges. Our team strives to automate processes wherever possible, using whichever tools are best for the job.
We strongly believe in engineering teams being responsible for the operations of their services in production. In this role, you’ll work closely with engineers to advocate and participate in sensible, scalable, systems design and share responsibility with them in diagnosing, resolving, and preventing production issues.

item.title: Product Reliability Operations Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Product Reliability Operations Analysts (PROs) design, build, and manage cutting-edge infrastructure and tooling that allows Palantir’s teams to operate efficiently and collaborate with ease. PROs embed with Product Development teams across the business to grow and improve team operations.
As a PRO, you are excellent at managing projects, organizing timelines, communicating change, and getting things done. You’ll have operational responsibilities from the outset, and over the course of your tenure are expected to streamline workflows and develop operational best practices. PROs are detail-oriented and have a passion for understanding how technology, systems and people work.
Example projects: • Product Campaigns: Product Reliability Operations Analysts help co-ordinate organization-wide initiatives. Whether the goal is to deprecate a software version across customers, ensure that a hotfix is deployed ASAP, or accelerate adoption of the latest features, PROs play an integral role in ensuring that Palantir is tracking business-critical actions across dozens of development teams and hundreds of production environments. • Customer Support & Trainings: Product Reliability Operations Analysts embed with Palantir’s customer support team and are responsible for designing, building, and operating our customer support ticketing and metrics systems. • Product Support Processes & Infrastructure: Product Reliability Operations Analysts work closely with Product Reliability Engineers to make sure that Palantir’s 24/7/365 emergency support system operates smoothly and evolves in step with our incident management frameworks.
For more information on the team, please read our Blog.

item.title: Product Reliability Engineer, New Grad
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Product Reliability Engineers (PREs) are the driving forces of stability across Palantir’s products and help to ensure our products are available 24/7. When something goes wrong, we are the first to respond and are responsible for triaging, troubleshooting, and coordinating the resolution of the issue.
Every day at Palantir is different: we’re constantly evolving to better respond to customer needs, and as a PRE you will work closely with our engineering and business teams to minimise risks associated with the deployment of our products. You are a resourceful, creative, and agile problem solver who is able to work both collaboratively and independently to resolve the most difficult and nebulous technical issues. This includes everything from creating product health metrics and automated alerts, to fixing product bugs, streamlining operational tasks, and developing and documenting strategies for responding to incidents.
Whatever the technical root cause of the issue is, you’ll play a central and critical role in resolving it — seeking not just a one-time fix, but a permanent solution.

item.title: Product Designer, US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Palantir Design Team is responsible for the human experience of using our software. Our team is growing rapidly, but we're committed to creating a tight-knit team environment that fosters trust, integrity, empathy, and growth. We work together in realizing a shared product vision, and regularly give feedback and critique to each other.
Designing at Palantir is a varied experience. On a given day, you might be: leading a design sprint for your product team; designing a micro-interaction to make a complex analytical task feel simple; and/or advocating for UX consistency by creating flexible, reusable UI components.
Core Responsibilities
• Interaction and visual design. As a product designer, you'll be involved at every stage of design work. You'll help define early product concepts, flesh out the high-level workflow and micro-interactions of a feature, and execute on a crisp and effective visual design. You should have experience with some of the following mockup and prototyping tools: Sketch, Framer, Principle, Figma, Invision. • User research. We frequently do informal user research, and value people who can be flexible with research processes and methodologies to achieve the right outcome. You'll often visit customer offices to interview and learn from the users we serve. You'll pair qualitative methods (e.g. scripted usability tests and contextual inquiry) with quantitative information, like product and usage metrics. • Prototyping. You will prototype—using software like Principle and Framer, or another favorite method—both to communicate your designs and validate your decisions. • Partnering with engineers. We work closely with product and forward deployed engineers to realize our design ideas. You'll treat engineers as partners and collaborate with them to prototype and build out products. • Awareness of how software interfaces are built. Familiarity with HTML, CSS, Javascript, and Typescript is appreciated. You don't need to be an expert—just fluent enough to collaborate with engineers, and know what's possible with frontend technologies. Resources and mentorship are available to designers who want to learn more.
Designers at Palantir have great autonomy over their work, so a wide skill set is necessary. However, many designers on the team are also passionate experts in one area. You might be the kind of designer who ships code every week, or the kind of designer who shares detailed user research findings with your team.

Designing at Palantir is a varied experience. On a given day, you might be leading a design sprint for your product team; designing a micro-interaction to make a complex analytical task feel simple; and/or advocating for UX consistency by creating flexible, reusable UI components.
Designers at Palantir have great autonomy over their work, so a wide skill set is necessary. However, many designers on the team are also passionate experts in one area. You might be the kind of designer who ships code every week, or the kind of designer who shares detailed user research findings with your team.
