item.title: Product Designer, Internship
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Product Design Team
We help to achieve connection and understanding. Our users must create knowledge from data in our software, potential customers and candidates need to understand and relate to the story of our company and the awesome work we do, and it’s our job to help tell these stories.
Designers are highly valued in the company for our vision, our ability to learn and adapt, and our creativity and inventiveness. We’re growing rapidly, yet focused on creating a tight-knit group of people that enjoy working together in an atmosphere that fosters trust, integrity, empathy, and growth. We rigorously share and promote our ideas and constantly incorporate feedback and critique.
The Role
As a Product Designer, you are a generalist who spans many design disciplines: user research, information architecture, prototyping, ideation, interaction design, and sometimes visual design. You will visit our users, listen, investigate, learn, and ideate. You know that form informs function and usability—that the surface layer doesn’t exist in a vacuum.
Sometimes we’re out in front, exploring brand-new problem spaces, figuring out what to build, and sometimes you’re deep in the details of micro-interactions, figuring out how to build it. You lead feature teams in design exercises ranging from day-long design studios to week-long design sprints.

item.title: Product Designer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Palantir Design Team is responsible for the human experience of using our software. Our team is growing rapidly, but we're committed to creating a tight-knit team environment that fosters trust, integrity, empathy, and growth. We work together in realizing a shared product vision, and regularly give feedback and critique to each other.
Designing at Palantir is a varied experience. On a given day, you might be: leading a design sprint for your product team; designing a micro-interaction to make a complex analytical task feel simple; and/or advocating for UX consistency by creating flexible, reusable UI components.
Core Responsibilities
• Interaction and visual design. As a product designer, you'll be involved at every stage of design work. You'll help define early product concepts, flesh out the high-level workflow and micro-interactions of a feature, and execute on a crisp and effective visual design. You should have experience with some of the following mockup and prototyping tools: Sketch, Framer, Principle, Figma, Invision. • User research. We frequently do informal user research, and value people who can be flexible with research processes and methodologies to achieve the right outcome. You'll often visit customer offices to interview and learn from the users we serve. You'll pair qualitative methods (e.g. scripted usability tests and contextual inquiry) with quantitative information, like product and usage metrics. • Prototyping. You will prototype—using software like Principle and Framer, or another favorite method—both to communicate your designs and validate your decisions. • Partnering with engineers. We work closely with product and forward deployed engineers to realize our design ideas. You'll treat engineers as partners and collaborate with them to prototype and build out products. • Awareness of how software interfaces are built. Familiarity with HTML, CSS, Javascript, and Typescript is appreciated. You don't need to be an expert—just fluent enough to collaborate with engineers, and know what's possible with frontend technologies. Resources and mentorship are available to designers who want to learn more.
Designers at Palantir have great autonomy over their work, so a wide skill set is necessary. However, many designers on the team are also passionate experts in one area. You might be the kind of designer who ships code every week, or the kind of designer who shares detailed user research findings with your team.

item.title: Procurement Operations Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Procurement Operations Analyst, you will sit on the Finance team and work across the procurement spectrum to ensure smooth and efficient purchasing, contracting, and supplier operations. As a motivated self-starter, you will be the liaison between procurement, vendors, and internal cross-functional teams to ensure that all purchases follow company procedures, meet expected service-level agreements (SLAs), have sufficient, thorough documentation, and that services and goods being rendered are compliant with the agreed upon contractual terms.

item.title: Procurement Counsel
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir’s dynamic in-house legal team works to proactively address legal issues so that Palantir can continue to drive and deliver positive impact in the world. As Procurement Counsel, you will provide critical support across the company by owning the drafting and negotiating process of third-party vendor contracts, partnership agreements, and non-disclosure agreements. In this role, you will have the unique and exciting opportunity to develop, implement, and own Palantir’s vendor contract negotiation workflow that will exist across multiple internal teams and stakeholders. You’ll maintain focus on thoughtfully reducing risk across our vendor contracts while also holding the larger vision needed to bring a large and multi-stepped procurement workflow to completion.
As Procurement Counsel, you are resourceful, capable of building strong business relationships, and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You are a proven expert in contract drafting and negotiation and are creative in your approach to analyzing issues. You proactively and effectively identify opportunities to streamline the contracting and negotiating process. You are meticulously organized, which allows you to handle an impressive volume of contracts. You are service oriented and share a sense of urgency with your internal stakeholders. You are passionate about the idea of scaling and enjoy utilizing technology and workflows in order to increase efficiency.

item.title: Privacy and Civil Liberties Software Engineer, New Grad
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re driven to solve the world's most critical and challenging problems, and believe that building software to enable human decision making is the most effective vector. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more.
The Role
The Privacy and Civil Liberties (PCL) team is a mission-driven interdisciplinary team of Software Engineers, Product Designers, Lawyers, and Applied Ethicists. The goal of the PCL team is to design, build, and deploy privacy and civil liberties protective technologies, and to foster a culture of responsibility around their development and use. Our team successfully manages multiple internal and external commitments simultaneously while navigating complex and nuanced political environments with care. We have deep expertise in privacy law and technology ethics, and are able to translate legal and ethical requirements into practical technical products.
As a Software Engineer on the Privacy and Civil Liberties (PCL) team, you will join a team responsible for designing and building world-leading software that enables Palantir and its customers to meet legal requirements and ethical obligations while achieving mission-critical outcomes. We manage our own suite of privacy enhancing technologies as well as collaborate closely with product teams to ensure privacy considerations are integrated at all levels of Palantir platforms. We also engage externally with customers and academia to ensure we remain engaged in solving cutting edge privacy issues. In this role, you will need to understand and stay up to date on rapidly changing socio-technical environments, and developing actionable technical solutions.

item.title: Personnel Security Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir's impact and productivity in the U.S. Government (USG) space depends on our ability to navigate the world of government and industrial security efficiently and responsibly. We're looking for a Personnel Security Specialist (PSS) who can both arbitrate policy and processes around personnel and clearances, and partner with our business leaders to plan for the future in support of our Department of Defense (DoD) mission.
As a Personnel Security Specialist, you'll be part of our U.S. Government Security Team, which is responsible for managing our personnel clearance program and our secure facilities and systems. The U.S. Government Security Team ensures compliance with security policies, regulations and processes within complex organizations, while also enabling Palantir to get people and resources where they’re needed most. As a member of the team, you'll provide first-class knowledge and customer service to the Palantirians who depend on you to help them push the business forward.
Our Personnel Security Specialists are tenacious, resourceful individuals who challenge conventional approaches to find better ways to navigate intricate bureaucracies. You'll execute important processes, reimagining and optimizing along the way to ensure faster outcomes that align with our customers' compliance requirements.

item.title: People Program Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a People Program Manager, you will support People Team projects from start to finish, concept to delivery. You’re passionate about streamlining workflows and reducing friction. You track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, own integral workflows and anticipate needs across the People team and the business.
This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, and execution skills. You have a keen eye for detail and critical thinking and you are someone who is motivated by consistently improving the internal processes and streamlining workflows across teams. Equally importantly, you find people-focused work exciting and rewarding. This company is filled with amazing, brilliant, and dedicated folks from around the world, and we work hard to serve and support all of them in our shared pursuit of the mission.

You track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, own integral workflows and anticipate needs across the People team and the business.
This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, and execution skills. You have a keen eye for detail and critical thinking and you are someone who is motivated by consistently improving the internal processes and streamlining workflows across teams. Equally importantly, you find people-focused work exciting and rewarding. This company is filled with amazing, brilliant, and dedicated folks from around the world, and we work hard to serve and support all of them in our shared pursuit of the mission.

item.title: People Partner
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The People Partner team is dedicated to driving business outcomes by cultivating a highly effective and engaged workforce in partnership with key business leaders. We work closely with all teams and at all levels to improve talent development, manage performance, and facilitate feedback across the organization. We help empower Palantirians to be as effective and impactful as possible.
People Partners work at both the strategic and tactical level. On any given day, we're designing new, scalable programs and frameworks, advising organizations on how to develop a culture of feedback, and iterating on how we can improve our efficacy as a team. People Partners regularly strike a balance between upside maximization initiatives (employee growth and development) and downside mitigation (performance, employee relations, etc.). We're involved in all the key moments of an employee's life cycle which results in a wide breadth of responsibilities and opportunities.

item.title: People Operations Coordinator
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Our People Operations team works hard to support all of the amazing, brilliant and dedicated folks at Palantir in the shared pursuit of our mission. As a People Operations Coordinator you will support various processes across the employee lifecycle (including employee onboarding, data management and reporting, etc.), as well as learn the broader context of people project work.
We’re a team that is committed to providing a high-quality service to all those we interact with, and pursues solutions in a thoughtful, iterative and empathetic way. Our ideal candidate has excellent attention to detail and is motivated by consistently improving internal processes that enhance the employee experience. Most importantly, if you find people-focused work exciting and rewarding, this role is for you.
---
As a People Operations Coordinator, you will support various processes across the employee lifecycle. You are passionate about People Operations (employee onboarding, data management and reporting, etc.), and committed to providing high-quality service to all those you interact with. You are looking to learn the broader context of people project work. You are outcome-oriented, and pursue solutions in a thoughtful, iterative, and empathetic way.
You have a keen eye for detail and critical thinking, a focus on accuracy, and extraordinary customer service skills. You are someone who is motivated by consistently improving internal processes that remove friction and enhance the employee experience. Most importantly, you find people-focused work exciting and rewarding. This company is filled with amazing, brilliant, and dedicated folks from around the world, and we work hard to serve and support all of them in our shared pursuit of the mission.

item.title: Partnerships Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Around the world, data is being generated at an exponential rate, and many government agencies and commercial institutions worldwide are ill-equipped to handle data at scale. Palantir’s software helps these organizations build data assets that enables efficient analysis and more effective management of their data, empowering them to solve their most critical problems.
The Sales Team is responsible for getting Palantir’s software to these organizations. As a Partnerships Manager, you will work hand in hand across our Global Partnerships Eco-System to find, evaluate, and pursue new business opportunities. Each Partner is different and each Partnerships Manager see these distinctions as opportunities — for creative thinking, diligent research, and value creation. A successful Partnerships Manager tailors their approach to each unique opportunity.
Armed with a deep knowledge of the product and its real-world applicability, you will cultivate existing relationships and work diligently to build new ones. You are motivated by the knowledge that the software Palantir sells is directly responsible for uncovering fraud, stopping wrongdoing, and saving lives.

item.title: Palantir Path, Internship
item.description:
We are now accepting applications for Summer 2023. Early application deadline is Tuesday, September 6 2022 at 9:00 AM PDT. Final deadline to apply is Monday, October 3 2022 at 9:00 AM PDT.
We know the path to tech looks different for everyone, and we believe in providing opportunities for people of all backgrounds to accelerate their personal and technical growth in preparation for a successful, impactful career. We launched Palantir Path to reach students who may not have had prior exposure to technical opportunities in an academic or industry setting, or who are earlier in their engineering journey, especially those from underrepresented communities.
As a Palantir Path intern, you'll be invested in from day one - and challenged accordingly with high-impact work! There's no sitting in a classroom all day or writing code that doesn’t live beyond the summer. Instead, Path interns join a team of dedicated, motivated engineers supporting a specific product or Palantir customer in solving multi-faceted, open-ended problems. You will be paired with a mentor who will help you learn to build real-world software and to think critically about how problems can — and can't — be solved with technology. You'll also find our internal community is full of people who are excited to meet you, build your community, and further your development and self-discovery outside of your project work.
At the end of the summer, with real-world experience and concrete feedback under your belt, you'll be better equipped to make the most of your remaining studies and tackle future engineering challenges with confidence!
We're currently welcoming applications for Summer 2023 opportunities. We especially encourage students from communities that are historically underrepresented in STEM to apply. This includes (but is not limited to) individuals from ethnic/racial minority groups, women, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community.

item.title: Operations Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As Operations Specialists, we do more than just support our leaders; we track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, drive operational outcomes, and anticipate needs, allowing the team to focus on the problems they are best equipped to solve. This role requires a combination of operations, project management, process optimization, and execution skills.
In this role, you’ll demonstrate your strength in organization and innovate on ways to help the people you support be as productive and impactful as possible. You’re resourceful and can drive toward a solution if things go awry. Communication is one of your greatest strengths and you excel at constructing order out of ambiguity.
You will also be responsible for driving projects forward and owning their operational outcomes. Our ideal candidate is innovative, collaborative, and can balance differing goals and viewpoints when identifying solutions You will be a part of a team of individuals who are just as passionate about supporting one another as they are about Palantir’s mission. We operate in a high accountability, high expectation environment where the goal is always to produce the best solution. Willingness to accept and respond to feedback are critical.

item.title: National Inside Business Development Representative
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We’re looking for a National Inside Business Development Representative to join our dynamic, rapidly-expanding team within one of the most exciting companies within the software technology space. Playing a critical role in helping the team achieve our customer acquisition and revenue goals, you will work directly with our growing Business Development team to expand the Palantir footprint. You will be directly involved in working with numerous national firms across multiple industries, helping them solve their most critical challenges and respond to their most important opportunities. In addition to getting exposure to Palantir’s software, this role also offers plenty of room for growth.

item.title: Mission Operations Systems Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Mission Operations Systems Analyst, you will develop applications, automation, and pipelines to solve pain points inside and outside the company. Utilizing your problem solving skills and technical resources, you will work side-by-side with stakeholders across Business Development to evolve Palantir's systems integration processes, enable priority business engagements, and implement custom infrastructure for our colleagues.
On the Mission Operations team, you are empowered to own your projects from end to end, iterating directly with your users and teammates to deliver technical outcomes that better our business. These outcomes may range from custom applications, to open source tools, to building on top of our core products to unlock Palantir's potential for our own operations. Past projects have included:
• Implementing systems for provisioning hundreds of Palantir stacks for bare metal use cases. • Building a pipeline for automatically deploying Stack Overflow Enterprise to AWS (Medium). • Delivering novel technical solutions for demonstrating Palantir products live in the field at major events.

item.title: Mission Operations Software Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Mission Operations Engineer, you will develop applications, automation, and data pipelines to address pain points impacting critical internally and externally-facing problems. You will work side-by-side with Forward Deployed Engineers, Site Reliability Engineers, and internal Support teams to to evolve Palantir's infrastructure, implement process improvements, and craft custom tools to improve the efficiency and scalability of critical business processes.
On the Mission Ops team, no week is quite like the last, but each project starts with a problem statement, then follows through development, deployment, and monitoring. You are empowered to own your projects from end to end, iterating directly with users and teammates to deliver technical outcomes that better our business. These outcomes may range from custom applications, to open source tools, to building on top of our core products to unlock Palantir's potential for our own operations. Past projects have included:
• Implemented solutions for automated provisioning of hundreds of Palantir product stacks on bare metal systems. • Built pipelines for automatically deploying Stack Overflow Enterprise to AWS (see our Medium Blog Post). • Created a full-stack application to enable the automatic assignment of support tickets to Palantir engineers on a global scale. • Delivered novel technical solutions for demonstrating Palantir products live in the field at major events.

item.title: Marketing Manager - Canada Public Sector
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir Technologies’ seeks a versatile Marketing Manager to help build and execute a marketing and communications strategy to support our go-to-market success in Canada.
As the first marketing hire in Canada, you will lead the creation and execution of a go-to-market plan focused on creating leads, opportunities, pipeline, and revenue for our Canadian public sector team with a strong product offering in ever-changing markets. Working in close collaboration with the broader organization, you will build a comprehensive marketing plan to reach your target customers and prospects and drive demand through events, traditional lead generation campaigns, and other integrated marketing programs in Canada.
As a Marketing Manager, you'll need to play a diverse set of roles, from crafting content yourself, through to supporting events and defining and executing against account-based marketing and digital marketing strategies. In this role, you will work closely with Palantir's Sales and Leadership teams for Canada, along with a cross-functional team of demand generation, content, sales, design, business development representatives and more - the team is growing fast, and you are joining at a key time to help shape it!
This role is an opportunity to embed deeply in a unique company with a highly technical environment. You'll be expected to keep up to date with our software products and effectively message their features, their value, and the emergent transformation they provide to our current and potential clients. You'll also be expected to calibrate a room of peers and/or stakeholders to achieve alignment and pull levers to generate revenue. The role and its surrounding organization aren't rigidly defined and are evolving fast, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment with savvy.

The Role
Palantir Technologies’ seeks a versatile Marketing Manager to help build and execute a marketing and communications strategy to support our go-to-market success in Canada.
As the first marketing hire in Canada, you will lead the creation and execution of a go-to-market plan focused on creating leads, opportunities, pipeline, and revenue for our Canadian public sector team with a strong product offering in ever-changing markets. Working in close collaboration with the broader organization, you will build a comprehensive marketing plan to reach your target customers and prospects and drive demand through events, traditional lead generation campaigns, and other integrated marketing programs in Canada.
As a Marketing Manager, you'll need to play a diverse set of roles, from crafting content yourself, through to supporting events and defining and executing against account-based marketing and digital marketing strategies. In this role, you will work closely with Palantir's Sales and Leadership teams for Canada, along with a cross-functional team of demand generation, content, sales, design, business development representatives and more - the team is growing fast, and you are joining at a key time to help shape it!
This role is an opportunity to embed deeply in a unique company with a highly technical environment. You'll be expected to keep up to date with our software products and effectively message their features, their value, and the emergent transformation they provide to our current and potential clients. You'll also be expected to calibrate a room of peers and/or stakeholders to achieve alignment and pull levers to generate revenue. The role and its surrounding organization aren't rigidly defined and are evolving fast, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment with savvy.

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher - Natural Language Processing (NLP)
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We are looking for someone that is passionate about natural language processing (NLP) and deep learning, someone that likes to push the boundaries of what is possible, and want to solve hard problems on top of unique datasets. You will be responsible for implementing, customizing, and inventing NLP deep learning techniques for some of the most challenging datasets. In this role, you will have the opportunity to get exposed to real customer problems early on and to help formulate, and drive novel deep learning solutions from the ground up.
Our Machine Learning team develops pioneering machine learning techniques to address immediate customer needs and to ensure Palantir’s platforms offer unparalleled machine learning capabilities.

item.title: Linux Engineer - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir’s impact and productivity in the US Government (USG) space depends on our ability to provide world class Information Systems (IS) to Palantirians. As a Linux Engineer you will streamline and secure our internal facing applications, storage, and physical server environment. You are an analytical thinker who enjoys troubleshooting issues and finding creative technical solutions. You will make data-driven decisions ensuring that we build systems that resolve and proactively address common issues before they impact end users. You automate yourself out of mundane tasks to focus on making a larger impact. You have strong customer service skills and a customer-driven mindset.
We are looking for people who are detail oriented, highly adaptive, and enjoy contributing to a dynamic team environment. If you love solving difficult engineering problems, pushing the boundaries of industry standards, and are passionate about redefining endpoint systems engineering, join our team. We've been waiting for you.

item.title: Legal Software Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us!
The Role
Just as our software helps solve our customers’ most challenging problems, it can help solve our own problems, too — with your help! Palantir’s Legal team is seeking a Software Engineer to provide critical support designing, building, and implementing world-leading software for our legal, data protection, and compliance workflows. In this role, you will apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help our team use data to drive our business and legal outcomes, just as our Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) do for our customers in the field. You will help design and implement product solutions that increase the efficiency and effectiveness of our legal, privacy, and compliance programs, developing solutions that may also help drive these outcomes for our customers, too.
Palantir’s Legal team is a multi-disciplinary group of lawyers and non-lawyers navigating and supporting our global business operations, our adherence to our ethical standards, and our compliance with external legal obligations. Our ideal candidate for this role will be passionate about using technology to develop actionable technical solutions while working closely with technical and non-technical counterparts. You will have an entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to learn new technologies and even develop them yourself. To succeed in this role, you must excel at working autonomously and making decisions independently, but doing so within a supportive, demanding, and interdependent team and broader organization.

item.title: Legal Operations - Contract Administrator
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir’s in-house legal team works to proactively address legal issues so that Palantir can continue to drive positive impact in the world. We are deeply embedded in Palantir’s mission and culture, take time to connect with folks across the global Palantir community, and are viewed across the company as key to Palantir’s success. Legal Operations is the organizational backbone of the legal team at Palantir and our Contract Administrators directly support all aspects of revenue generation at the company. Our Contract Administrators have a strong understanding of Palantir’s growth strategy, and are eager to implement and operationalize that strategy in our contracting processes. Our Contract Administrator have a passion for helping others, making them an invaluable resource to our customer deal pipeline.
As a Contract Administrator, you will be handling a wide variety of responsibilities throughout the customer contracting lifecycle. You will support Palantir’s lawyers and contracting specialists, in collaboration with our Sales team and executives, to facilitate the growth of our business by managing all aspects of contract administration. As a Contract Administrator, you will become an expert in your specific customer vertical, take ownership for specialized scaling projects and critical initiatives as it relates to each business unit. Throughout your work, you take initiative, operate with resourcefulness, and execute quickly and effectively the processes that drive revenue at Palantir. Most importantly, you have a true desire to be helpful and go above and beyond to solve challenges. You’ll leverage your excellent communication skills, and exercise tact and diplomacy in helping to manage relationships with teams across Palantir.

item.title: Legal Operations - Administrative Assistant
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir’s dynamic in-house legal team works to proactively address legal issues so that Palantir can continue to drive positive impact in the world. We are deeply embedded in Palantir’s mission and culture, take time to connect with folks across the global Palantir community, and are viewed across the company as key to Palantir’s success. Legal Operations is the organizational backbone of the legal team at Palantir. Legal Operations is a mission-focused team that strives to support and execute on critical initiatives across the legal team.
As an Administrative Assistant, you will be involved in a wide variety of centralized functions that support the legal team including but not limited to document administration, team-wide calendaring, event and in-office coordination, legal vendor management and targeted project assistance. You will be directly supporting multiple attorneys located within your office/region and providing ad-hoc support to the in-office legal team and work closely with a team of other legal administrative assistants within Legal Operations.
Throughout your work, you take initiative, operate with resourcefulness, and execute quickly and effectively. You enjoy helping others and can think three steps ahead to anticipate any additional needs. You are impeccably organized, excellent at time management, and extremely detail oriented. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and are passionate about building trust with other members of the team through reliable and consistent bias towards action. Most importantly, you have a true desire to be helpful and go above and beyond to solve challenges.

item.title: Legal Counsel - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir's legal team works to proactively address legal issues so that Palantir can continue to drive positive impact in the world. Our US Government lawyers are the legal backbone of Palantir's federal government business, and are motivated by our mission to serve government clients. As go-to advisors on the contracts that enable Palantir to implement its state of the art technology to solve real-world problems, our goal is to enable our US government agency customers to unlock their data and power critical operations.
In this role, you will work on every issue Palantir faces in its US government business, including negotiating complex license and services agreements, responding to litigation and regulatory requests, providing strategic advice to business teams, and handling intellectual property, compliance, data privacy, and employment issues.
You’ll be required to draw on strong communication and interpersonal skills to perform a variety of tasks, whether it’s negotiating with opposing counsel, advising business teams on product issues, or troubleshooting a draft proposal. You'll be expected to operate in demanding situations and take on novel, complex issues as they arise. This role requires attention to detail and the broad vision needed to bring large and multi-phase projects to completion. Although this role is focused on our US government business, you will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of projects that arise at our fast-paced, mission-oriented company.

item.title: Knowledge Manager - Proposal and Capture Strategy Team
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir Technologies' Proposal and Capture Strategy Team, known internally as the Wordsmiths, are seeking a Knowledge Manager to support the team's processes and systems for knowledge management, project reporting, and documentation. We work closely with Palantir's engineering, business development, and legal teams to articulate Palantir's value proposition on a wide range of topics. Our outputs include strategic and technical analyses of complex IT procurements, as well as detailed responses to requests for proposals (RFPs) / requests for tenders (RFTs). As Knowledge Manager you will support various team infrastructure needs, streamlining our day-to-day work and maximizing our impact within a cross-functional environment.

item.description:

The Role
As an Internal Development Recruiter at Palantir, you will directly impact the company's future by identifying and attracting excellent candidates for our organization, specifically the teams within ID. Our Internal Development teams help keep Palantir running – whether it's Finance, Legal, People, or Core Operations, these teams are essential to the success of Palantir and you will be essential to their success. In this role you will be partnering with hiring managers across a broad range of different roles to help these teams scale with the rest of the business. The ability to identify and source high quality candidates and be responsible for landing them on the appropriate team is critical. Finally, you will own Recruiting partnerships and guide stakeholders through the entire hiring process, managing a variety of nuanced situations along the way.

item.title: Infrastructure Security Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As an Infrastructure Security Engineer, you are responsible for the security of Palantir’s people and infrastructure around the globe. Your technical expertise is second only to your integrity and real passion for security and technology in general. Our ideal candidate works well on a team, is highly motivated, and enjoys solving problems and taking on new challenges.
In this role, you’re building, breaking, and securing the global infrastructure that powers our world-changing products. You have a strong security mindset, care deeply about infrastructure, and are excited to protect our network and endpoints against all threats. You'll design, architect, and drive security posture changes for Palantir, and work to make life hard for our adversaries.

item.title: Information System Security Manager (ISSM)
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir's impact and productivity in the US Government (USG) space depends on our ability to navigate the world of government and industrial security efficiently and responsibly. As the Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM), you own the systems that enable our employees to productively utilize our USG facilities and related enclaves in support of our critical DoD missions. You are responsible for maintaining compliance, building resilient infrastructure, managing access to systems, and partnering with users to address a myriad of problems they may encounter as they build advanced capabilities in support of DoD/IC missions. Our ideal candidate demonstrates a keen instinct for balancing compliance and functionality, has a desire to learn new skills, and a passion for helping others.

At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As an Information Security Recruiter at Palantir, you will directly impact the company's future by identifying and attracting excellent candidates for our organization, specifically the teams within the Information Security (InfoSec) and Technical Operations teams. These teams help keep Palantir secure and scalable– whether it's Application Security, CIRT, DevOps or Helpdesk Support, these teams are essential to the success of Palantir and you will be essential to their success. In this role you will be partnering with hiring managers across a broad range of different roles to help these teams scale with the rest of the business. Your ability to identify and source high quality candidates and to land them on the appropriate team is critical. Finally, you will own Recruiting partnerships and guide stakeholders through the entire hiring process, managing a variety of nuanced situations along the way.

item.title: Information Security Engineer, Internship
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Information Security’s mission is to secure Palantir, and by extension, protect our customers and their critical data. Your technical expertise is second only to your integrity and real passion for security and technology in general. Our ideal candidate works well on a team, is highly motivated, and enjoys solving problems and taking on new challenges. The work we do is not always clearly defined, so being able to work to outcomes with unclear paths should excite you. You have a strong security approach, care deeply about product and infrastructure, and are excited to protect Palantir against all threats. You'll design, architect, and drive security posture changes for Palantir, and work to make life hard for our adversaries.
This internship has wide-reaching impact, strong autonomy, and the resources and empowerment to make significant security improvements across all of Palantir. The skills and background of successful candidates may vary highly, but curiosity, tenacity, and a drive to be a world-class security engineer are the underpinnings of our team.
Information Security Interns are treated just like full time engineers, with significant freedom and ownership over their work. Interns take responsibility for real world projects and outcomes that our customers rely on.

item.title: Information Security Engineer (Counter Abuse)
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Our products support some of the most important and impactful work in the world, including defense, intelligence, and commercial applications. We are trusted by our customers to protect their information in the face of advanced persistent threats. The mission of the Counter-Abuse Technology (CAT) team is to make our software platforms more secure for customers by detecting and defeating fraud and abuse.
As an Information Security Engineer on CAT, you’re responsible for detecting, responding to, and defeating fraud and abuse on our hosted software platforms. You'll own the tooling, telemetry, and processes to fight adversaries across the full account lifecycle, including account abuse or takeover primitives, billing and payment fraud, and unauthorized or illicit usage of our software (e.g. malware, spam, CSAM, unauthorized use cases, etc.)
The stakes are high, and you will be up against ever-evolving adversaries. The work is complex and dynamic, and you will have wide-reaching impact, strong autonomy, and the resources and empowerment to make our platforms safer for our customers.

item.title: Information Security Engineer (CIRT)
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As an Information Security Engineer, you are responsible for the security of Palantir’s people and infrastructure around the globe. Your technical expertise is second only to your integrity and real passion for security and technology in general. Our ideal candidate works well on a team, is highly motivated, and enjoys solving problems and taking on new challenges.
In this role you’ll be the first line of defense for protecting Palantir. You’ll be part of a team responsible for the 24/7 prevention, detection, and investigation of security events and active attacks across our entire infrastructure. Your work will directly impact the success of Palantir's mission as you seek to make life hard for our adversaries and protect our global network.

item.title: Information Assurance Technician
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir’s impact and productivity in the US Government (USG) space depends on our ability to provide world class Information Systems (IS) to Palantirians. As an Information Assurance Technician (IAT) you will support our end users. You are an analytical problem solver and enjoy troubleshooting issues and finding creative technical solutions. You will make data-driven decisions ensuring that we build systems that resolve and proactively address common issues before they impact end users. You automate yourself out of mundane tasks to focus on making a larger impact. You have strong customer service skills and a customer-first approach.
We are looking for people who are detail oriented, highly adaptive and enjoy contributing to a dynamic team environment. If you love solving difficult engineering problems, pushing the boundaries of industry standards, and are passionate about redefining endpoint systems engineering, join our team. We've been waiting for you.

item.title: Industrial Security Operations and Admin Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As an Operations and Administrative Specialist on our USG Industrial Security Team, you will be involved in a range of centralized functions that support this team, including but not limited to document administration, team-wide and individual calendaring, event and in-office coordination, vendor management and targeted project assistance.
Throughout your work, you take initiative, operate with resourcefulness, and complete tasks quickly and effectively. You enjoy helping others and can anticipate additional needs. You are organized, excellent at time management, and extremely detail-oriented. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and can build trust with other members of the team through reliable and consistent bias towards action. Most importantly, you have a true desire to be helpful and go above and beyond to solve challenges.

item.title: Incident Management Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Incident Management Engineers are the driving forces of stability across Palantir’s products. IME’s help to ensure Palantir fixes critical issues immediately. When something goes wrong, IME’s are the first to respond and are responsible for triaging, troubleshooting, and coordinating the resolution of the issue.
You’ll be a member of a centralized team responsible for managing the most critical outages. You are an excellent communicator, collaborator, and troubleshooter and can use both of these skills in fast-paced and high-stakes environments. You are able to parse technical details quickly and know when to ask for help when you need it.
Whatever the issue is, you are ensuring it gets resolved at a high bar as quickly and seamlessly as possible.

Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Incident Management Engineers are the driving forces of stability across Palantir’s products. IME’s help to ensure Palantir fixes critical issues immediately. When something goes wrong, IME’s are the first to respond and are responsible for triaging, troubleshooting, and coordinating the resolution of the issue.
You’ll be a member of a centralized team responsible for managing the most critical outages. You are an excellent communicator, collaborator, and troubleshooter and can use both of these skills in fast-paced and high-stakes environments. You are able to parse technical details quickly and know when to ask for help when you need it.
Whatever the issue is, you are ensuring it gets resolved at a high bar as quickly and seamlessly as possible.

item.title: Implementation Security Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Implementation Security Engineers work directly with Palantir’s U.S. Government customers to ensure that Palantir’s software solutions meet and are accredited to Government information security requirements. Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for their most critical operations and our ability to successfully implement and demonstrate the security of our software is essential to customer trust and mission success. We're seeking dedicated and motivated individuals with Systems Administration, Software Development, or Systems Engineering backgrounds to join our team to support solution accreditation for government agencies. You will collaborate with other Palantir engineers to ensure security policies and settings are in place, build standardized security documentation, and generate evidence of compliance once settings have been applied. You will assemble artifacts and evidence into an organized repository and serve as the primary point of contact for one or more U.S. Government customers on security and compliance requirements and questions. You will also work with Palantir software developers and architects to recommend specific technical features in new or existing software in order to ensure compliance.
There is no typical day for our Implementation Security Engineers. We operate software in diverse environments around the world, including AWS, Azure, on-premises, and at all classification levels. Correspondingly, each customer has different security requirements. We will rely on you to ensure the ongoing security and trust of these clients via hands-on access and coordination with other teams. In this role, you will learn every day. Palantir's technology is cutting-edge and constantly evolving. You will build knowledge and skills in the latest cloud, edge, and information security technologies with on-the-job education and mentorship. Curiosity and a critical eye are key to success.

item.title: Implementation Programme Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As an Implementation Programme Manager, you are the operational engine behind Palantir’s forward deployed engineering teams. You partner with our Forward Deployed Engineers and Deployment Strategists to optimize our product implementation process. You track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate stakeholder needs to ensure engineers are able to focus their time and attention on the technical problems they are best equipped to solve. Your creative approach to project management centers around frameworks that enable rapid iteration, while operating in harmony with the team’s vision and the end users’ needs.
This position requires a combination of project and team management, process optimization, customer relationship management, and execution skills. You are a person who loves fixing problems and embraces the opportunity that an obstacle presents.

Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As the Head of Procurement, you’ll be leading a nascent organization that is growing both in size and impact. You’ll first dig in to understand the current landscape, and then begin to build and implement your long-term strategic vision for the evolution of the function. You will rely on your core team of procurement operators, contract experts, and sourcing managers to ensure company growth is met with thoughtful scale and automation in your processes. In this role, you will have the opportunity to have a direct and measurable financial impact on our bottom line and improve the purchasing experience for stakeholders around the company.

item.title: Head of Legal Operations
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir’s in-house legal team works to proactively address legal issues so that Palantir can continue to drive positive impact in the world. Legal Operations is the backbone of the legal team and is key to fulfilling Palantir’s mission. In that pursuit we strive to cultivate Palantir's philosophy, develop relationships across the company, and operate with a service mindset. We develop a strong understanding of business strategy, and have a passion for helping others, making us an invaluable resource. We’re a team that values both creativity and teamwork - whether operating solo or collaboratively, we endeavor to achieve great results.
The Head of Legal Operations will be the driving force of innovation, scale, technology and automation. You will be responsible for leading, building, and streamlining the strategic technologies and operational functions of the legal team. You will work with other leaders and Legal Operations teammates to help implement key systems, optimize processes, manage projects, and create objectives and performance metrics for both Legal Operations and the broader team. You will also partner closely with Palantir’s attorneys and paralegals to understand the needs and develop solutions that scale alongside the business.
Our ideal candidate will take initiative, operate with discretion and resourcefulness, and thrive off of executing on and supporting the processes, systems and platforms of the legal team. Most importantly, they have a true desire to be helpful and go above and beyond to solve challenges.

item.title: Government Commercial Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Government Commercial Specialists enable us to meet and exceed the full gamut of our contractual obligations through the acquisitions lifecycle. As part of Palantir's in-house legal team, you'll work closely with partners from across the business in Engineering, Finance, and Business Development. Though you'll focus on government contracts, you'll also have the opportunity to contribute to the team's broader mandate by helping push deals across the finish line and supporting other projects that arise at our fast-paced, mission-focused company.
As a Government Commercial Specialist, your passion for government acquisitions matches our commitment to our government customers' missions. You will draft contracts, lead negotiations, and provide guidance to the business on complex proposals. You are energized by navigating bureaucracy and managing external relationships, and constantly seek more ownership and impact to keep pace with Palantir's diverse and growing portfolio of government partnerships.

item.title: Global Mobility Coordinator
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Our Global Mobility Team supports the safe and seamless movement of Palantir employees around the world. We are responsible for supporting and scaling Palantir’s global mobility program in close coordination with internal partners, external vendors, and Palantir’s dedicated People Team.
As a Global Mobility Coordinator, you will implement processes that support our immigration and relocation practices. You are a strong operator and committed to providing high-quality service. You are also capable of handling a full portfolio of casework with a keen eye for detail, a focus on accuracy, and excellent customer service skills.
This position is based in London. You may occasionally be required to travel to Palantir's other US offices and offices in EMEA.

item.title: Global Benefits Coordinator
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Benefit Coordinator, you are responsible for health and wellness program operations, day-to-day benefit administration, and employee education at Palantir. You are outcome-oriented, and pursue solutions in a thoughtful, iterative, and empathetic way. You have a keen eye for detail and critical thinking, a focus on accuracy, and excellent customer service skills. You are someone who is motivated by helping employees through onboarding, educating new hires about our benefits, managing vendors to ensure the services they provide are high quality, and consistently improving processes that remove friction and enhance the employee experience.
Most importantly, you find people-focused work exciting and rewarding. Our company is filled with amazing, brilliant and dedicated folks from around the world, and we work hard to serve and support our colleagues in the shared pursuit of our mission.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We build software that helps our customers answer their most critical questions: what is causing the products we manufacture to fail? Are our traders engaging in risky activity? Where did this strain of E. coli originate, and who else could it affect? As a Full Stack Developer, you architect the interfaces that our customers use to solve their biggest problems.
The mission of a Full Stack Developer is to design and build capabilities that let users visualize and interact with their data to meet their analytical needs. To achieve that mission, Full Stack Developers are involved in all stages of the product development and deployment lifecycle: idea generation, user interviews, planning, design, prototyping, execution, shipping, and iteration.
You might spend one day interviewing users to suss out the questions they need to ask of their data and the next brainstorming mockups with Product Designers. Then it's time to take on the hard technical problems: figuring out how to make it possible for a user to explore the full range of data, at vast scale, then dive deep to understand each data point at a granular level.

item.title: Forward Deployed Software Engineer: UK Public Sector
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) work directly with customers to quickly understand their greatest problems and design and implement solutions to use data against them. Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations, and projects often start with an open ended question like “Why are we delaying so many flights?” or “How can we better identify instances of money laundering?” As an FDSE, you’ll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help organizations use their data to drive a real impact in the world. You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.
As an FDSE your responsibilities look similar to those of a startup CTO: you’ll work in small teams with minimal supervision and own end-to-end execution of high stakes projects. Your day might span discussing architecture with fellow engineers, wrangling massive-scale data, coding a custom web app, speaking with customer executives, or establishing strategy for your team.
Whether you aspire to be an entrepreneur or an engineering leader, we believe Palantir is the best place — with the best colleagues — to learn how. You’ll learn how to unpack a problem and understand the costs and consequences of its solution. You’ll learn new technologies and languages, and even develop them yourself. You’ll work autonomously and make decisions independently, within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow and develop.

Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations, and projects often start with an open ended question like "How do we evaluate wildfire risk and optimize a power grid as a result" or "How do we quickly assess our food supply chain and modify it to deliver life saving assistance on time?" As an FDSE, you’ll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help organizations use their data to drive a real impact in the world. You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.

A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use their data. Our technology has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations, and projects often start with an open ended question like "How do we evaluate wildfire risk and optimize a power grid as a result" or "How do we quickly assess our food supply chain and modify it to deliver life saving assistance on time?" You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.
As an FDSE Intern, your responsibilities look similar to those at a small startup, with the resources, stability and mentorship of an established tech company: You’ll work in small teams with minimal supervision and own end-to-end execution of high stakes projects. Your day might span discussing architecture with fellow engineers, wrangling massive-scale data, coding a custom web app, speaking with customer executives, or establishing strategy for your team.
FDSE Interns are treated just like full time engineers, with significant freedom and ownership over their work. Interns take responsibility for real world projects and outcomes that our customers rely on.

item.title: Forward Deployed Software Engineer - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) understand our customers’ greatest pain points and design end-to-end solutions to address them. FDSEs solicit constant feedback on their work from both customers and colleagues, improving our products over time with rapid iteration cycles.
FDSEs deploy ground breaking technical solutions to solve our customers’ hardest problems. Projects often start with a nebulous question like “Why are we losing customers?” or “How can we more effectively identify instances of money laundering?” FDSEs lead the way in developing a solution, from high-level system design and prototyping to application development and data integration. As an FDSE, you leverage everything around you: Palantir products, open source technologies, and anything you and your team can build to drive real impact.
You work with customers around the globe, where you gain rare insight into the world’s most important industries and institutions. We help our customers detect insider trading, improve disaster relief, fight healthcare fraud, and more. Each mission presents different challenges, from the regulatory environment to the nature of the data to the user population. You will work to accommodate all aspects of an environment to drive real technical outcomes for our customers.
Whether you aspire to be an entrepreneur or an engineering leader, we believe Palantir is the best place — with the best colleagues — to learn how. You’ll learn how to unpack a problem and understand the costs and consequences of its solution. You’ll learn new technologies and languages, and even develop them yourself. You’ll work autonomously and make decisions independently, within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow and develop.

Projects often start with a nebulous question like “Why are we losing customers?” or “How can we more effectively identify instances of money laundering?” FDSEs lead the way in developing a solution, from high-level system design and prototyping to application development and data integration. As an FDSE, you leverage everything around you: Palantir products, open source technologies, and anything you and your team can build to drive real impact.
You work with customers around the globe, where you gain rare insight into the world’s most important industries and institutions. We help our customers detect insider trading, improve disaster relief, fight healthcare fraud, and more. Each mission presents different challenges, from the regulatory environment to the nature of the data to the user population. You will work to accommodate all aspects of an environment to drive real technical outcomes for our customers.
Whether you aspire to be an entrepreneur or an engineering leader, we believe Palantir is the best place — with the best colleagues — to learn how. You’ll learn how to unpack a problem and understand the costs and consequences of its solution. You’ll learn new technologies and languages, and even develop them yourself. You’ll work autonomously and make decisions independently, within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow and develop.
