item.title: Forward Deployed Software Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) work directly with customers to quickly understand their greatest problems and design and implement solutions to use data against them. Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations, and projects often start with an open ended question like “Why are we delaying so many flights?” or “How can we better identify instances of money laundering?” As an FDSE, you’ll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help organizations use their data to drive a real impact in the world. You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.
As an FDSE your responsibilities look similar to those of a startup CTO: you’ll work in small teams with minimal supervision and own end-to-end execution of high stakes projects. Your day might span discussing architecture with fellow engineers, wrangling massive-scale data, coding a custom web app, speaking with customer executives, or establishing strategy for your team.
Whether you aspire to be an entrepreneur or an engineering leader, we believe Palantir is the best place — with the best colleagues — to learn how. You’ll learn how to unpack a problem and understand the costs and consequences of its solution. You’ll learn new technologies and languages, and even develop them yourself. You’ll work autonomously and make decisions independently, within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow and develop.
Our Principles
• Impact: We take on meaningful and challenging projects that change the world for the better. • Ownership: We see projects through from beginning to end, working through any obstacles we may encounter. • Collaboration: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds — such as other FDSEs, product teams, and Deployment • Strategists. We also work externally with our customers, often on site, to understand and solve their problems. • Trust: We trust each other to effectively manage time and priorities and give people the space to think for themselves. • Growth: We encourage ourselves and our peers to seek new challenges and opportunities for growth, as well as find new ways to innovate and share knowledge. • Learning: We often face entirely novel problems where we need to pick up a lot of new knowledge and learn how to use it to make progress. We believe experiential learning is one of the best teachers.
What We Value
• Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics, and Data Science. • A highly analytical mindset and eagerness to solve technical problems with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools. • Experience or interest in working with and using large scale data to solve valuable business problems. • Strong coder with demonstrated proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, C++, TypeScript/JavaScript, or similar. • Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals, and comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users. • Ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision. • Willingness and interest to travel as needed to client sites. Ability to travel 25-50% preferred, but requirements vary by team and location.
Palantir is committed to promoting a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that all Palantirians share the responsibility of upholding our commitment to these values and encourage candidates from a wide range of backgrounds, perspectives, and lived experiences to join us in solving the world’s hardest problems.
Palantir is committed to making the job application process accessible to everyone. If you are living with a disability (visible or not visible) and need to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, please reach out and let us know how we can help.

Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations, and projects often start with an open ended question like “Why are we delaying so many flights?” or “How can we better identify instances of money laundering?” As an FDSE, you’ll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help organizations use their data to drive a real impact in the world. You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.
As an FDSE your responsibilities look similar to those of a startup CTO: you’ll work in small teams with minimal supervision and own end-to-end execution of high stakes projects. Your day might span discussing architecture with fellow engineers, wrangling massive-scale data, coding a custom web app, speaking with customer executives, or establishing strategy for your team.

item.title: Forward Deployed Software Engineer
item.description:
Une entreprise qui transforme le monde qui nous entoure
Chez Palantir, nous concevons des logiciels qui offrent des solutions aux problèmes les plus importants au monde. Nous établissons des partenariats avec les plus puissantes institutions afin de transformer l’utilisation de leurs données. Nos logiciels sont utilisés afin d’empêcher des attaques terroristes, découvrir de nouveaux médicaments, déjouer des fraudes bancaires, et bien plus encore. Si ces types de projets vous intéressent, nous serions heureux de vous accueillir parmi nous.
Le poste
Les Forward Deployed Software Engineer (FDSE) travaillent directement avec les clients afin de comprendre rapidement leurs problèmes les plus importants et ainsi concevoir et implémenter des solutions qui vont utiliser cette donnée afin de résoudre ces problèmatiques. Nos clients s’appuient sur les plateformes de Palantir pour certaines de leurs opérations les plus critiques, et les projets commencent souvent par une question ouverte comme « Pourquoi nos vols sont-ils si souvent retardés ? » ou « Comment pouvons-nous identifier plus efficacement les cas de blanchiment d’argent ? ». En tant que FDSE, vous appliquez votre capacité à résoudre les problèmes, votre créativité et vos compétences techniques pour aider les organisations à exploiter au mieux leurs données et avoir ainsi un impact réel sur le monde. Vous avez l’opportunité d’obtenir des informations rares et de contribuer à certaines des industries et institutions les plus importantes au monde.
En tant que FDSE, vos responsabilités ressemblent à celles d’un directeur technique de startup : vous travaillez en petites équipes avec une supervision minimale et êtes responsable de l’exécution « end-to-end » de projets à enjeux élevés. Votre journée peut consister à discuter de l’architecture avec d’autres ingénieurs, à gérer des données à grande échelle, à coder une application web personnalisée, à discuter avec l’équipe dirigeante du client ou à établir une stratégie pour votre équipe.
Que vous aspiriez à devenir entrepreneur ou leader en ingénierie, nous pensons que Palantir est le meilleur endroit (avec le meilleur esprit d’équipe) afin d’apprendre à le devenir. Vous apprendrez à décortiquer un problème et à en comprendre les coûts ainsi que les conséquences de sa solution. Vous apprendrez de nouvelles technologies et de nouveaux langages, et vous pourrez également les développer vous-même. Vous travaillerez de manière autonome et prendrez des décisions de manière indépendante, au sein d’une communauté qui vous soutiendra et vous mettra au défi tout au long de votre parcours et de votre développement.
Nos principes
• Impact : Nous entreprenons des projets significatifs et ambitieux qui rendent le monde meilleur. Responsabilité : Nous menons nos projets du début à la fin, en surmontant tous les obstacles que nous pourrions rencontrer. • Collaboration : Nous travaillons en interne avec des personnes d’horizons variés, tels que d’autres FDSE, des équipes Produits et des Deployment Strategists. Nous travaillons également en externe avec nos clients, souvent sur site, afin de comprendre et résoudre leurs problèmes. • Confiance : Nous nous faisons confiance les uns aux autres afin de gérer efficacement le temps et les priorités et donner aux individus l’espace nécessaire pour réfléchir par eux-mêmes. • Développement : Nous nous engageons et encourageons les personnes à rechercher de nouveaux défis et des nouvelles opportunités de croissance, ainsi qu’à trouver de nouvelles façons d’innover et de partager les connaissances. • Apprentissage : Nous sommes souvent confrontés à des problèmes totalement inédits, pour lesquels nous devons engranger beaucoup de nouvelles connaissances et apprendre à les utiliser pour avancer. Nous considérons que l’apprentissage par l’expérience est l’une des meilleures écoles.
Le profil recherché
• Solide expérience en ingénierie, de préférence dans des domaines tels que l’informatique, les mathématiques, le Software Engineer et la physique. • Un état d’esprit hautement analytique et la volonté de résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux structures de données, aux systèmes de stockage, à l’infrastructure cloud, aux frameworks front-end et à d’autres outils techniques. • Expérience ou intérêt à travailler avec et à utiliser des données à grande échelle pour résoudre des problèmes métier importants. • Excellent codeur avec des compétences avérées dans des langages de programmation tels que Python, Java, C++, TypeScript/JavaScript ou similaire. • Capacité avérée à collaborer efficacement avec des équipes de personnes techniques et non techniques, et à travailler dans un environnement en évolution rapide avec des objectifs dynamiques et des itérations utilisateur. • Maîtrise de langages de programmation tels que Python, Java, C++, TypeScript/JavaScript ou similaire. • Capacité à collaborer efficacement avec des équipes de personnes techniques et non techniques, et à travailler dans un environnement en évolution rapide avec des objectifs dynamiques et des itérations utilisateur. • Capacité démontrée à apprendre continuellement, à travailler de manière autonome et à prendre des initiatives avec un minimum de supervision. • Propension et intérêt à se déplacer sur les sites client en fonction des besoins. Capacité de passer 25 à 50 % du temps en déplacement de préférence, mais les exigences peuvent varier selon l’équipe et l’emplacement.
Palantir s’engage à promouvoir une culture de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion. Nous sommes convaincu(e)s qu’il incombe à tou(te)s les Palantirien(ne)s de maintenir notre engagement envers ces valeurs et nous encourageons les candidat(e)s issu(e)s d’un large éventail de milieux, de perspectives et d’expériences vécues à se joindre à nous pour résoudre les problèmes les plus difficiles au monde.
Palantir s’engage à rendre le processus de candidature accessible à tou(te)s. Si vous vivez en situation de handicap (visible ou non) et que vous devez demander un aménagement raisonnable pour toute partie du processus de candidature ou d’embauche, veuillez nous contacter et nous indiquer comment nous pouvons vous aider.

item.title: Forward Deployed Operations Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Forward Deployed Operations Engineers (FDOEs) work with existing customers or global teams to support the day to day operations of a Foundry deployment. Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations; as an FDOE, you’ll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to support organizations’ Foundry stacks and critical workflows. You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.
Every day at Palantir is different: we’re constantly evolving to better respond to customer needs, and FDOEs are embedded with our internal support and business teams to maximize the outcomes of our deployed products and workflows. You are a resourceful, tenacious, and agile problem solver who is able to work both collaboratively and independently to resolve difficult and nebulous technical issues, as well as work productively with external customers to debug and resolve their problems. This includes creating new data pipelines and customer workflows, building health metrics and automated alerts, fixing bugs in pipelines and products, and developing and documenting strategies for engaging with customer support.
Every Palantirian is encouraged to play to their personal strengths, so there is no “one size fits all” approach to engineering at Palantir. The scope of this role is intentionally broad so that people can find their strengths and grow in a way that excites them.

item.title: Forward Deployed Architect - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Forward Deployed Architect, you will own the architectural vision and secure system design of complex systems of systems in support of Palantir’s US Department of Defense and Intelligence Community customers. Alongside Palantir engineering and business leads, you will guide deployment teams to execute securely in customer technical environments, design sustainable architectures, and act as a thought partner to our government counterparts. You will also help set the strategic direction for our customer engagements and participate in technical outreach meetings.
We are looking for an individual that deeply understands the architecture of software systems and how all the components integrate into a complete solution that meets both end user needs and stringent information security requirements. As a Forward Deployed Architect, you will also act as an advisor to our product development teams to ensure their solutions comply with current and future requirements and can operate in heterogeneous deployment environments.
Sample backgrounds for individuals in this role include having worked as a Software Architect, Cybersecurity Architect, Enterprise Systems Architect and/or a Solutions Architect for cloud or distributed system environments. Success in this role requires becoming technically proficient in Palantir’s products, understanding our customers’ governance processes and security obligations, and demonstrating how we’ll comply with them through product demonstrations, presentations, and documents. You’ll operate independently but with a team-first mindset as you partner with our product development teams and deployment teams to design and shape holistic solutions in complex technical environments.

item.title: Forward Deployed Architect
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir works with some of the world’s largest institutions, and rapport with our customers’ IT departments is critical to our shared success. We are looking for a technically savvy, outcome-oriented individual to develop relationships with technical counterparts at our customer organizations.
As a Forward Deployed Architect, you will own relationships with our technical counterparts and serve as an interface between Palantir deployment teams and customer IT organizations. Alongside Palantir technical leads, you will guide deployment teams to operate safely in customer environments, design sustainable engagements, and act as a thought partner to our counterparts. You will also help set the strategic direction for our customer engagements and participate in technical outreach meetings. Sample backgrounds for folks in this role include having worked as a CTO, a Big Data Department Lead, and/or a Solution Architect for cloud or distributed system environments.
Success in this role requires becoming technically proficient in Palantir’s products, understanding our customers’ governance processes, and demonstrating how we’ll comply with them through product demonstrations, presentations, and documents. You’ll operate independently but with a team-first mindset as you navigate relationships to lead our deployment teams to success in complex environments.

item.title: Financial Analyst - Compensation
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Financial Analyst, you will be part of Palantir’s Finance team and provide analytical and business planning support focused on our largest area of investment. You’ll develop an intimate understanding of what drives Palantir’s success by partnering with key stakeholders to analyze and report on the financial impact of decisions across the company.

item.title: Finance Program Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Finance Program Manager deployed within our Finance team, you will be the operational engine behind our team and systems. You will be responsible for crafting, implementing, and executing processes to streamline workflows and reduce friction across the business. You’re a creative thinker and operational executor with strong interpersonal skills who can partner with stakeholders across the company to track and stabilize projects, anticipate needs, and remove roadblocks.
In this role, you’ll leverage your background in finance and deploy Palantir’s products to create, automate, and scale our financial reporting workflows. This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, and execution skills, in addition to a comprehensive knowledge of financial workflows and reporting systems. You are a person who loves fixing problems and always embraces the best idea, even when it is not your own.

item.title: Finance Program Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Finance Program Manager deployed within our Finance team, you will be the operational engine behind our team and systems. You will be responsible for crafting, implementing, and executing processes to streamline workflows and reduce friction across the business. You’re a creative thinker and operational executor with strong interpersonal skills who can partner with stakeholders across the company to track and stabilize projects, anticipate needs, and remove roadblocks.
In this role, you’ll leverage your background in finance and deploy Palantir’s products to create, automate, and scale our financial reporting workflows. This position requires a combination of project management, process optimization, and execution skills, in addition to a comprehensive knowledge of financial workflows and reporting systems. You are a person who loves fixing problems and always embraces the best idea, even when it is not your own.

item.title: Facility Security Officer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir's impact and productivity in the US Government (USG) space depends on our ability to navigate the world of government and industrial security efficiently and responsibly. We're looking for a Facility Security Officer (FSO) who can both arbitrate policy and processes around personnel and clearances, and partner with our business leaders to plan for the future in support of our Department of Defense (DoD) mission.
As a Facility Security Officer, you'll be part of our Government Security Team, which is responsible for managing our personnel clearance program and our secure facilities and systems. The Government Security Team ensures compliance with security policies, regulations and processes within complex organizations, while also enabling Palantir to get people and resources where they’re needed most. As a member of the team, you'll provide first-class knowledge and customer service to the Palantirians who depend on you to help them push the business forward.
Our Facility Security Officers are tenacious, resourceful individuals who challenge conventional approaches to find better ways to navigate intricate bureaucracies. You'll execute important processes, reimagining and optimizing along the way to ensure faster outcomes that align with our customers' compliance requirements.

item.title: Executive Assistant
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Our team of Administrative Executive Assistants does more than just support our leaders: we’re the backbone of busy people at Palantir. We build strong relationships with the people we support and anticipate their needs without being asked. Our passion for helping others makes us an invaluable resource at Palantir.
As an Administrative Executive Assistant, you will be handling a variety of professional and personal responsibilities, including expenses, travel, and calendaring. You are very organized and thrive off of enabling the people you support to be as productive and impactful as possible. You’ll leverage your excellent communication skills, and exercise tact and diplomacy in helping to manage relationships with senior stakeholders both internal and external to Palantir. In this role you'll also demonstrate good judgment and strategic thinking by understanding competing priorities and prioritizing accordingly.

item.title: Events Marketer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Events Marketers bring external events to life, creating fun and welcoming environments for prospects and communities to connect. As an Events Marketer at Palantir you’ll be part of our dynamic, rapidly-expanding Demand Generation team and will focus on creating events to raise brand awareness, progress opportunities, and bring existing customers together to share best practices.
At Palantir, you'll work across the Demand Generation team to support unique business units as well as execute on large-scale corporate events. You'll collaborate with business stakeholders and operational teams to design and execute great events while tying back investments to bottom of funnel sales outcomes. Success in this position relies on your ability to own and manage multiple large projects, often simultaneously, with many moving parts and in multiple geographic locations. Our ideal candidate will adapt easily to change, take initiative in solving problems, and demonstrate excellent organizational skills to ensure flawless execution.

item.title: Engineering Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As an Engineering Manager, you will lead a team responsible for mission critical infrastructure efforts that allow our engineers, business and product to scale across a large number of environments. You care deeply about your team, invest in their personal growth and support them in maximizing their impact to the business. You love developing, coaching and growing people across different subject areas and crafts.
You have a deep systems background and value technical excellence, and use that to guide the team towards well-engineered and durable solutions. While you aren’t expected to spend a large percentage of time coding, you are expected to be able to evaluate and raise the technical bar, and help others attain it. You will play a part in engineering, design reviews, code reviews, and will contribute to the code base directly when needed. You lead by example rather than authority.
You can effectively develop a high-trust, inclusive environment within the team. Any room that you enter should have more certainty and a firmer plan by the time that you leave it. You may walk into a situation where people have lost track of their goals and after your involvement, you get everyone aligned on a clear path forward. You remove unimportant details, distill complex situations to their essence, and get the right decision-maker to make a call – even if it’s not you.
The core infra team is responsible for building the Kubernetes based infrastructure and API platform on top of which we deploy Palantir’s software offerings (Foundry, Gotham). The environment management team is responsible for building out our service management infrastructure. You can read more about the problem statement here.

item.title: Enablement Partner
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a USG Enablement Partner you’ll work as a part of our deployment teams, closely collaborating with Product Engineers and Deployment Strategists in the field to expand the use of Palantir and serve as a trusted partner to customers on the ground. If you are passionate about supercharging customer growth and mission impact through partnership with Palantir users, we want to meet you.
Enablement Partners are strategic and empathetic communicators who are able to manage client accounts and relationships. Our strengths include the ability to identify gaps in the product and internal operations, build effective and scalable solutions to address these gaps, and execute across a variety of responsibilities. We strive to create paths forward for our clients to ensure they’re supported in their use of innovative technology to solve USG’s most difficult and important problems.

item.title: Employee Relations Specialist (US)
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Employee Relations Specialist will partner with our Employment Counsel and People Partners to investigate workplace related incidents, in a remote working environment and in our offices, strongly focused on our US locations. As part of the People Team, the Employee Relations Specialist will manage all aspects of US workplace investigations and find solutions consistent with our culture and business values. Though the Employee Relations Specialist will focus on resolving investigations, complaints and disciplinary actions, they will also provide pragmatic HR advice and assist the broader People Team with other employment issues and cross functional efforts, described below.

item.title: Embedded Analyst
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Embedded Analyst is part of our global Business Development team and is responsible for implementing various financial processes to support our growing business. As a member of the Embedded Analyst team you will partner closely with leadership, helping us implement key processes and functions aimed towards achieving our most crucial goals. Teams throughout Palantir will consult with and rely on you to help guide planning and decision-making for a wide range of topics. You are a self-starter who can anticipate questions and future challenges, and are eager to help find data-driven solutions to those questions.

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Identity
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a DevOps Engineer on Palantir’s Identity team, you will design, build and manage identity infrastructure and tooling. You will make it easier and more secure to implement identity governance and access management for Palantirians and our customers all over the world. As part of Palantir’s world-class Information Security organization, you will work closely with Security Engineers to research, implement and scale innovative solutions to help Palantir stay ahead of a dynamic threat landscape.
The Identity team consists of DevOps Engineers who are passionate about reducing risk, friction and eliminating toil. The team’s primary focus is the management of identity platforms for both corporate and production (customer-facing) infrastructure. As part of the team, you will build novel web services that help Palantirians stay compliant while minimizing impact on their productivity flows. Your work will directly impact and improve the resilience of mission critical Palantir infrastructure that enables and empowers a globally distributed workforce.

A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a DevOps Engineer on Palantir’s Identity team, you will design, build and manage identity infrastructure and tooling. You will make it easier and more secure to implement identity governance and access management for Palantirians and our customers all over the world. As part of Palantir’s world-class Information Security organization, you will work closely with Security Engineers to research, implement and scale innovative solutions to help Palantir stay ahead of a dynamic threat landscape.
The Identity team consists of DevOps Engineers who are passionate about reducing risk, friction and eliminating toil. The team’s primary focus is the management of identity platforms for both corporate and production (customer-facing) infrastructure. As part of the team, you will build novel web services that help Palantirians stay compliant while minimizing impact on their productivity flows. Your work will directly impact and improve the resilience of mission critical Palantir infrastructure that enables and empowers a globally distributed workforce.

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a DevOps Engineer, you will be part developer, and part operations, with a mindset to automate everything. In this role you’ll push continuous integration and ensure smooth and efficient delivery of software systems across a broad range of company-wide infrastructure. You will help architect and operate essential cloud infrastructure in AWS, Azure and GCP, as well as novel solutions for disconnected environments. Our ideal candidate cares deeply about improving the overall automated testing and delivery story, as well as the communications between all engineers, customers, and management relying on the infrastructure. You will be partnering closely with other organizations in the delivery pipeline to build a collaborative atmosphere between teams that focus on application development, data science, and infrastructure management.

item.title: Desktop Support Engineer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Desktop Support Engineer, you are the go-to for any and all issues related to the hardware that enables our employees to be productive while they are in the office or on the go. You are responsible for fixing the myriad of problems brought to to you with an unparalleled instinct for diagnosing the issue and a passion for helping others. Not content to just consider an issue resolved by a quick fix, you want to understand our users regular workflows in order to identify the best solution for any problem that pops up, and you are excited to learn new skills that broaden the scope of problems you can help fix. While you have the knowledge and expertise to work with machines, you enjoy interacting with people and helping someone new. No one at Palantir dreads going to IT to ask a question because each member of the team is genuinely excited to help employees solve their technology problems.

item.title: Deployment Strategist, New Grad
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re driven to solve the world's most critical and challenging problems, and believe that building software to enable human decision making is the most effective vector. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more.
What We're About
At its core, the Deployment Strategist role centers around leveraging data in operational and real-world action. Our customers come to us with a hunch that the only way to protect their troops, manufacture high-quality products, structure effective healthcare policies, or deliver aid to refugees safely is to make better use of their data. Deployment Strategists are responsible for turning that hunch into reality.
If you believe in the transformative power of data and technology and in your own ability to bring that power to bear against complex problems, we want to meet you.
What We Do
As a Deployment Strategist, you'll work as part of a driven and creative team of Engineers, Product Designers, and other Deployment Strategists to deploy software against the most challenging problems our world faces. Your mission is to synthesize disconnected streams of thought into a cohesive understanding of what the most important problem is, what the data means, what the product needs, what users are motivated by, and where the impact could be.
Deployment Strategists are do-ers who immerse themselves in our customers' most intricate workflows, partner with customer teams and explore the data, and dive into the product landscape to enable us to scale. A select number of Deployments Strategists may also be deployed to Palantir internal teams and problems. In this role, the problems you'll tackle will require a curious and analytical mindset, a sharp intuition for product, and a strong degree of user empathy to ultimately empower our customers to make better decisions.

item.title: Deployment Strategist - Resourcing
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Deployment Strategist deployed within the Resourcing team you are responsible for supporting new business growth and the delivery of our offerings through staffing-centered solutions. You will be responsible for balancing the demands of the business with the supply of your division which entails deeply understanding the population of Palantirians and making prioritization calls that are in-line with global business strategy. You will need to understand the complexity behind difficult tradeoffs and own the execution of your decisions from end to end.
How we direct and invest Palantirians’ time is a critical element of our business strategy. You’ll use a combination of strategic problem solving, creative thinking, project management, and execution skills. You are a strong collaborator - able to work with teams and leaders across the company, navigate conflicting priorities, and drive towards action. You are a person who loves diving into the details but can also make decisions from a 10,000 foot perspective. You aren’t intimidated by complex problems and are motivated by the opportunity to influence the outcomes of our most critical work and the career paths of an extremely talented pool of employees.

item.title: Deployment Strategist - Capture
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
What We're About
At its core, the Deployment Strategist – Capture role centers around collaborating with our customers to solve high-impact challenges within their organization. You will be a key member of our new business teams to identify, pursue, and convert opportunities at new and existing customers. Our customers come to us with a hunch that the only way to protect their troops, manufacture high-quality products, structure effective healthcare policies, or deliver aid to refugees safely is to make better use of their data. Our capture-focused Deployment Strategists are responsible for partnering with our customers to identify new opportunities and demonstrate how our technology can meet their needs.
If you believe in the transformational power of data and technology and in your own ability to bring that power to bear against complex problems, we want to meet you.
What We Do
As a Deployment Strategist - Capture, you'll work as part of a driven team of other Deployment Strategists, Account Executives, and Engineers to match software to the most challenging problems our world faces. Your mission is to synthesize disconnected streams of thought into a cohesive understanding of what the most important problem is and navigate a path to convert ideas into production work that delivers value to the customer.
Deployment Strategists - Capture are do-ers who build lasting relationships with customers, understand their problems, and dive into the product landscape to enable us to scale. In this role, the problems you'll address require strong communication skills, the ability to drive towards clear goals in complex and fast-moving customer environments, a curious and analytical mentality , a sharp intuition for product, and a strong degree of user empathy to ultimately empower our customers to make better decisions.

Deployment Strategists - Capture are do-ers who build lasting relationships with customers, understand their problems, and dive into the product landscape to enable us to scale. In this role, the problems you'll address require strong communication skills, the ability to drive towards clear goals in complex and fast-moving customer environments, a curious and analytical mentality , a sharp intuition for product, and a strong degree of user empathy to ultimately empower our customers to make better decisions.

item.title: Deployment Strategist - Business Operations & Strategy
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re driven to solve the world's most critical and challenging problems, and believe that building software to enable human decision making is the most effective vector. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more.
What We're About
At its core, this role is about uncovering dots and—without knowing the shape they form—figuring out how to connect them. Our customers come to us with a hunch that the only way to protect their troops, manufacture high-quality products, structure effective healthcare policies, or deliver aid to refugees safely is to make better use of their data. Deployment Strategists are responsible for turning that hunch into reality.
If you believe in the transformational power of data and technology and in your own ability to bring that power to bear against complex problems, we want to meet you.
What We Do
As a Deployment Strategist, you'll work as part of a driven and creative team of Engineers, Product Designers, and other Deployment Strategists to deploy software against the most challenging problems our world faces. Your mission is to synthesize disconnected streams of thought into a cohesive understanding of what the most important problem is, what the data means, what the product needs, what users are motivated by, and where the impact could be.
Deployment Strategists are do-ers who immerse themselves in our customers' most intricate workflows, partner with customer teams and explore the data, and dive into the product landscape to enable us to scale. A select number of Deployments Strategists may also be deployed to Palantir internal teams and problems. In this role, the problems you'll tackle will require a curious and analytical mindset, a sharp intuition for product, and a strong degree of user empathy to ultimately empower our customers to make better decisions.

item.title: Deal Team - Business Affairs
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Our Deal Team members collaborate with multiple Palantir teams to proactively engage with existing and prospective commercial customers, leading the structuring and negotiation of deal terms so that Palantir can continue to drive positive impact in the world.
As a member of the Deal Team, you will partner closely with Palantir’s Sales, Legal, Finance, and Engineering teams to drive deal execution and support our sales efforts at scale, while directly owning the development and negotiation of commercial terms for commercial customers. You will use your expertise to unite our customer’s needs and considerations with our company’s commercial strategy, using your creativity to identify the right structure and approach for each customer. You will also utilize your understanding of the business landscape and build relationships with internal partners, increasing the visibility of deal progress and forecasting impact across all levels of our organization, from analysts to C-suite executives.
In this role, you will also support various special projects that arise at our fast-paced, mission-focused company. We’re a team that values both creativity and teamwork. Whether operating solo or collaboratively, we endeavor to achieve great results on challenging, time-sensitive deal discussions and projects.
You'll be given open ended objectives and expected to find ways to turn them into outcomes. By focusing on the broad vision without losing sight of the details, you'll bring large and multi-phase deals to successful completion while prioritizing team outcomes over individual wins. You are able to deliver complex commercial contract and deal information in an understandable way, and can manage high touch stakeholders in a constantly shifting landscape. You are ready to become an expert on the intricate details of deal negotiations and contracts that enable Palantir to implement its cutting-edge technology to solve real-world problems.

item.title: Deal Team - Business Affairs
item.description:
Une entreprise qui transforme le monde qui nous entoure
Chez Palantir, nous concevons des logiciels qui offrent des solutions aux problèmes les plus importants au monde. Nous établissons des partenariats avec les institutions les plus influentes afin de leur permettre d’utiliser pleinement leurs données. Nos logiciels sont utilisés pour empêcher des attaques terroristes, découvrir de nouveaux médicaments, déjouer des fraudes bancaires, et bien plus encore. Si ces types de projets vous intéressent, nous serions heureux de vous accueillir parmi nous.
Le poste
En collaboration avec d’autres équipes Palantir, les membres de notre équipe chargée des transactions (la « Deal Team ») approchent proactivement nos clients professionnels, actuels ou potentiels, et pilotent la mise en forme et la négociation de conditions contractuelles pour permettre à Palantir de continuer à avoir un impact positif dans le monde.
En tant que membre de la Deal Team, vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de nos services commercial, juridique, financier et d’ingénierie pour mener à bien la conclusion de contrats et soutenir nos efforts de vente dans la mesure qu’il convient, tout en étant directement responsable du développement et de la négociation des conditions commerciales avec la clientèle professionnelle. Vous utilisez votre expertise pour harmoniser les besoins et les points de vue de nos clients avec la stratégie commerciale de notre entreprise et vous faites appel à votre créativité pour identifier l’approche et la structure qui conviennent à chaque client. Vous mettez à profit votre connaissance des contextes de marché et vous établissez des relations avec les partenaires internes pour accroître la visibilité des progrès des activités contractuelles et en prévoir l’impact à tous les niveaux de notre organisation, des analystes aux cadres dirigeants.
Dans ce rôle, vous accompagnez également divers projets spéciaux qui peuvent se présenter à une entreprise comme la nôtre, à croissance rapide et axée sur les missions. La créativité et le travail d’équipe sont des valeurs de notre société. Que nous opérions en solo ou en collaboration, notre ambition est que les discussions et les projets d’accord difficiles et urgents débouchent sur de superbes résultats.
Les objectifs qui vous sont attribués restent ouverts, à charge pour vous de les transformer en résultats. En vous concentrant sur la vision d’ensemble sans perdre de vue les détails, vous menez à bien des négociations importantes et multi-phases, tout en donnant la priorité aux résultats de l’équipe sur la réussite individuelle. Vous savez fournir des informations sur les négociations et les contrats complexes d’une manière compréhensible et vous savez maintenir la proximité avec les parties prenantes dans un contexte commercial en constante évolution. Vous êtes prêt(e) à devenir un(e) expert(e) de l’intrication des détails en matière de négociations et de contrats, permettant ainsi à Palantir de mettre en œuvre sa technologie de pointe pour résoudre des problèmes du monde réel.
Les responsabilités clés
Mettre au point les conditions tarifaires et la structure commerciale pour chaque client, en collaboration avec vos interlocuteurs de la force de vente.Gérer les négociations des conditions commerciales pendant le processus de conclusion de marché, diriger ou orienter la communication en fonction de la situation et rédiger les documents à l’appui des négociations des contrats, y compris les propositions de prix et les formulaires de commande. Coopérer avec les équipes internes des services commercial, juridique, financier et d’ingénierie pour mener les accords jusqu’à la signature, fournir des conseils fiables pour naviguer dans les processus de négociation et d’achat et rester engagé sur tout le cycle de vie du client pour développer et négocier les conditions commerciales pour les opportunités de renouvellement et de montée en gamme du panier d’achat. Assurer l’alignement des conditions de chaque accord avec la stratégie générale de l’entreprise, tout en tenant compte des besoins et des points de vue de chaque client. Collaborer avec le service financier pour permettre à la direction de constater la progression des négociations contractuelles et lui fournir des prévisions d’impact. Présenter les résultats de notre travail et nos propositions de nouveaux marchés à des publics allant des analystes aux cadres dirigeants et exploiter vos expériences individuelles avec les clients pour proposer des améliorations de la structuration des offres et des conditions contractuelles.
Le profil recherché
• Plus de 5 ans d’expérience de la négociation de contrats commerciaux ou de partenariat ; une expérience de la négociation des SaaS ou d’autres formes d’accords technologiques est un atout certain. • Expérience démontrée en matière d’approche créative et analytique des problèmes. • Capacité à établir des relations solides et à collaborer avec une équipe transversale et avec les clients, appuyée par une communication efficace et de solides compétences en matière de rédaction et de service client. • Solides compétences en gestion de programme/projet, dont la capacité à gérer plusieurs priorités contradictoires dans un contexte d’urgence et à respecter les délais avec une supervision ou un soutien administratif minimal. • Facultés d’adaptation, d’empathie et d’introspection ; disposition à apprendre, à enseigner, à diriger et à suivre les instructions. • Volonté et possibilité de travailler en dehors des heures de travail normales si nécessaire.
Palantir s’engage à promouvoir une culture de diversité, d’équité et d’inclusion. Nous sommes convaincu(e)s qu’il incombe à tou(te)s les Palantirien(ne)s de maintenir notre engagement envers ces valeurs et nous encourageons les candidat(e)s issu(e)s d’un large éventail de milieux, de perspectives et d’expériences vécues à se joindre à nous pour résoudre les problèmes les plus difficiles au monde.
Palantir s’engage à rendre le processus de candidature accessible à tou(te)s. Si vous vivez en situation de handicap (visible ou non) et que vous devez demander un aménagement raisonnable pour toute partie du processus de candidature ou d’embauche, veuillez nous contacter et nous indiquer comment nous pouvons vous aider.

item.title: Deal Team - Business Affairs
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Our Deal Team members collaborate with multiple Palantir teams to proactively engage with existing and prospective commercial customers, leading the structuring and negotiation of deal terms so that Palantir can continue to drive positive impact in the world.
As a member of the Deal Team, you will partner closely with Palantir’s Sales, Legal, Finance, and Engineering teams to drive deal execution and support our sales efforts at scale, while directly owning the development and negotiation of commercial terms for commercial customers. You will use your expertise to unite our customer’s needs and considerations with our company’s commercial strategy, using your creativity to identify the right structure and approach for each customer. You will also utilize your understanding of the business landscape and build relationships with internal partners, increasing the visibility of deal progress and forecasting impact across all levels of our organization, from analysts to C-suite executives.
In this role, you will also support various special projects that arise at our fast-paced, mission-focused company. We’re a team that values both creativity and teamwork. Whether operating solo or collaboratively, we endeavor to achieve great results on challenging, time-sensitive deal discussions and projects.
You'll be given open ended objectives and expected to find ways to turn them into outcomes. By focusing on the broad vision without losing sight of the details, you'll bring large and multi-phase deals to successful completion while prioritizing team outcomes over individual wins. You are able to deliver complex commercial contract and deal information in an understandable way, and can manage high touch stakeholders in a constantly shifting landscape. You are ready to become an expert on the intricate details of deal negotiations and contracts that enable Palantir to implement its cutting-edge technology to solve real-world problems.

item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Sales Operations team is part of our Sales Finance team and is a critical partner in the quote-to-cash process. In this role you‘ll partner with Sales/Deal Teams, Sales Finance, Legal, billing, revenue, and tax teams to streamline and formalize the deal close out process.
Our ideal candidate will be able to work collaboratively and build relationships across the business. You're a creative problem solver who's energized by the opportunity to align with projects and initiatives centered on improving efficiency, Salesforce automation, and simplifying processes.

item.title: Corporate Counsel
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As Corporate Counsel, you’ll join Palantir’s in-house legal team as the legal backbone of our corporate and securities team. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual keen to join a team that cultivates Palantir's equity philosophy, connects with folks across the Palantir community, and sees itself as key to Palantir’s mission.
As a specialist, you will help advise and work on a variety of corporate and securities issues and transactions, while interacting directly (and frequently!) with our Chief Legal and Business Affairs Officer, Chief Financial Officer, and company leadership. You will work closely with our finance and stock administration teams on equity matters and administration. You will take on novel, complex issues as they arise, and bring multi-stepped projects to completion. You will also be a key contributor to the legal team and to the company as a whole, with the opportunity to work on a wide array of legal matters, including negotiating commercial agreements with Fortune 50 companies and working on regulatory, intellectual property, employment, and international issues.

item.title: Corporate and Securities Paralegal
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir’s legal team is seeking a corporate and securities paralegal to join a team that strives to cultivate Palantir's philosophy, connects with folks across the global Palantir community, and sees itself as key to Palantir’s mission. In this role, you will contribute to our corporate governance and equity operations, aid in the preparation and filing of various public company disclosures, and design processes, workflows, and resources to increase team efficiency.
We’re a team that values both creativity and teamwork - whether operating solo or working collaboratively, we endeavor to achieve great results on challenging, time-sensitive projects. Our ideal candidate is organized, resourceful and has strong attention to detail, with the ability to deliver information in a concise and understandable way, and who's keen to contribute to a dynamic company solving some of the world’s hardest problems.

item.title: Content Strategist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We're looking for a Content Strategist to join a cross-functional group of creatives who are responsible for communicating Palantir's work and values. This role is an opportunity to embed deeply in a unique company with a highly technical environment. Our mandate is broad, and you'll work on projects that span internal, external, and client communications as you contribute to the development of Palantir's global communications strategies.
As a Content Strategist, you'll help ensure consistency and quality across many different channels. You're a strong writer and editor comfortable in mediums from white papers to blog posts, who can consider and synthesize many inputs to create a shippable product quickly. You'll make recommendations on how to improve ideas and artifacts, partner with speakers to build talks, and brainstorm with business leaders on how to disseminate their most important messages. You’ll also prepare documents that clearly and effectively communicate the features and benefits of Palantir’s products, collaborating with engineers to translate highly technical and complex concepts into powerful written products. The ability to engage on design topics is important in this role. We aren't looking for formal training or skills, but you should be able to think about communications artifacts holistically — everything matters, not just the words.

You'll make recommendations on how to improve ideas and artifacts, and brainstorm with our sales team and business leaders on how to disseminate their most important messages. item.title: Content Specialist - Sales Enablement - EMEA
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We're looking for a Content Specialist to join a cross-functional group of creatives who are responsible for providing high-impact sales assets to fuel our growing Commercial Sales organization. As a Content Specialist within the Sales Enablement team, you will consider and synthesize many inputs to create a shippable product quickly. You'll make recommendations on how to improve ideas and artifacts, and brainstorm with our sales team and business leaders on how to disseminate their most important messages. You’ll also prepare documents that clearly and effectively communicate the features and benefits of Palantir’s products, collaborating with engineers to translate highly technical and complex concepts into powerful written products. An eye for design is important in this role. We aren't looking for formal training or skills, but you should be able to think about communications artifacts holistically — everything matters, not just the words.
This role is an opportunity to embed deeply in a unique company with a highly technical environment. You'll be expected to keep up to date with our software products and effectively message the impact they have on our current and potential clients. The role and its surrounding organization aren't rigidly defined, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment with savvy.

item.title: Compliance Operations Assistant
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us!
The Role
Palantir is seeking a Compliance Operations Assistant to provide critical support in the development, maintenance and execution of our Global Compliance program. As part of the Legal Compliance team, you will partner closely with our partners around the organization (including Legal, Finance, Tech-Compliance and PCL) to support and optimize legal compliance workflows. We are a team that values creativity and teamwork. Whether operating solo or collaboratively, we endeavor to achieve great results on challenging projects.
Our ideal candidate for this role will take initiative, operate with resourcefulness, and execute quickly and effectively. To succeed in this role, you must be comfortable undertaking a combination of administrative, project management, process optimization, and operational tasks. This role is a great opportunity for a candidate who is interested in a career in compliance administration.

item.title: Compliance Manager
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir Technologies is seeking a Technical Compliance Manager to support our rapidly growing public sector business - specifically covering markets in Europe, APAC, and Canada.
As the first Technical Compliance hire to focus on these public sector markets, you will be entrusted with helping our business successfully navigate the international compliance space. You will also be responsible for driving outcomes that are critical to our success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated and accountable to key partners across the business. You will also need to be innovative, collaborative, and willing to hear and respond to feedback. The role and its surrounding organisation aren't rigidly defined, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment with savvy to fulfil critical business initiatives.

item.title: Communications Operations Analyst - Programming
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We're looking for a Communications Operations Analyst - Programming to join a cross-functional group of creatives who are responsible for communicating Palantir's work and values. As a Communications Operations Analyst - Programming, you'll work with teams across the organization to manage external-facing creative projects. You will operate unified project management systems and drive improvements and updates to these systems based on project flow and team needs.

item.title: Communications Operations Analyst - Producer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We're looking for a Producer to join a cross-functional group of creatives who are responsible for communicating Palantir's work and values. Our scope is broad, and we work on projects that span internal, external, and client communications, all while contributing to the development of Palantir's global communications strategies.
As a Producer, you'll work alongside Content Strategists and Designers and a wide range of partners that may change per project. Your main role will be as the operational backbone on key programming initiatives spanning across mediums such as video and live streamed events. You’ll supervise and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate business partners’ needs in order to enable your creative counterparts to be as productive and impactful as possible. You’ll also craft and implement processes to streamline workflows and scale your team’s reach.
Our ideal candidate loves fixing problems and adopts the best idea, even when it is not their own. This role and its surrounding organization aren't rigidly defined, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment and pick up new skills along the way.

item.title: Communications Operations Analyst - Employee Experience
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We're looking for a Communications Operations Analyst to join a cross-functional group of operators and analysts who are responsible for executing on internal initiatives that support Palantir's work and values. Our mandate is broad, and you'll work on projects that span Employee Experience operational responsibilities as well as internal communications and logistics support.
Working alongside other Communications Analysts, you will be responsible for supporting projects and programs across Employee Experience, Events and Learning. As the operational backbone on key programming initiatives, you will craft, implement, and execute processes to streamline workflows and scale your team’s reach. You’ll track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate business stakeholders’ needs in order to enable company-wide programming. You are a person who loves fixing problems, creating structure, and embraces the best idea - even when it is not your own. item.title: Communications Designer - Static
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We're looking for multidisciplinary Communications Designers to join our group of creatives. Our team of Communications Designers are responsible for upholding Palantir's brand standards and providing solutions for a broad set of design needs across the company. We’re the visual storytellers for branding, marketing, presentations, and events.
Our mandate is broad: in this role, you'll create everything from brands for high-profile events to diagrams that explain our technology to videos that tell our most important stories. Along the way, you'll learn new skills that will help you realize your vision, whether that means picking up new software to drive animations or designing a new way to collect feedback.
You'll be joining a rapidly evolving team that touches a wide array of high-profile projects across the company. We're looking for self-starting creatives who can take ownership of their projects and deliver outcomes while balancing competing priorities, in collaboration with team members, project directors, third party vendors, and company leadership. The ideal designer thrives in a dynamic environment with a variety of stakeholders, whether that's on site with a customer or in preparation for a meeting of our board of directors.
We're looking for someone who is excited to take an active role in shaping Palantir's developing brand. Designers should be able to demonstrate a variety of creative styles and methodologies, with proven experience and examples from past work.

item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love to hear from you.
The Role
Palantir’s in-house legal team works to proactively address legal issues so that Palantir can continue to drive positive impact in the world. As Commercial Counsel, you will be responsible for all aspects of commercial contracting, including deal structuring, and drafting, review, and negotiation of revenue generating contracts. You will also be integral to developing scalable infrastructure for providing legal support to Palantir's rapidly growing portfolio of commercial customers, and play a strategic role in helping Palantir achieve its goals in a time of dynamic growth.
We’re a team that values both creativity and teamwork. Whether operating solo or collaboratively, we endeavor to achieve great results on projects of all types. You'll be given open ended objectives and will find ways to turn them into outcomes. By focusing on the broad vision without losing sight of the details, you'll bring large and multi-phase projects to successful completion while prioritizing team outcomes over individual wins. You are able to deliver complex information in an understandable way, and can manage high touch business partners in a constantly shifting landscape.
Our ideal candidate should enjoy the responsibility and autonomy that comes with owning problems and finding solutions. You can effectively navigate a diverse organization involving a wide variety of audiences, including under time-sensitive situations. You are ready to jump into a deal at a moment’s notice and become an expert on the intricate details of the contracts that enable Palantir to implement its cutting-edge technology to solve real-world problems. You are passionate about conceiving and implementing scalable systems that increase your impact, and that of the Commercial Contracting team.

item.title: Commercial Contracts Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love to hear from you.
The Role
Palantir’s in-house legal team works to proactively address legal issues so that Palantir can continue to drive positive impact in the world. As a Commercial Contracts Specialist, you will be a non-attorney partnering closely with Commercial Counsel to effectively support our rapidly growing portfolio of commercial customers. In this role, you will also work closely with Palantir’s Sales, Legal, Finance, and Engineering teams, while owning the drafting, administration, and negotiation of commercial customer contracts, and building infrastructure to support our commercial customers at scale.
As you develop expertise with our commercial contracts and build relationships with our internal partners, you will become adept at quickly researching and answering factual and interpretive contractual questions as needed. You will also support various special projects that arise at our fast-paced, mission-focused company.
We’re a team that values both creativity and teamwork - whether operating solo or collaboratively, we seek to achieve great results on challenging, time-sensitive projects. You'll be given open ended objectives and will find ways to turn them into outcomes. By focusing on the broad vision without losing sight of the details, you'll bring large and multi-phase projects to successful completion while prioritizing team outcomes over individual wins. You are able to deliver complex information in an understandable way, and can manage high touch stakeholders in a constantly shifting landscape. You are ready to become an expert on the intricate details of the contracts that enable Palantir to implement its cutting-edge technology to solve real-world problems. You are passionate about conceiving and implementing scalable systems that increase your impact, and that of the Commercial Contracting team, over time.
