item.title: Client Executive - US Navy, Naval Sea Systems Command and Associated Warfare Centers
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Client Executives are critical members of Palantir’s US Government team. Responsible for growing the business, they partner with business development and technical execution stakeholders to identify and win major opportunities. Client Executives find, evaluate, and pursue new business opportunities for a targeted institution or geography, seeking US Government and industry partners whose missions, objectives, and values align with our own. By developing and executing strategy for new customer acquisition, this role will make an outsized impact on the organization’s growth trajectory.
Palantir is fast-paced, and in this role you'll be expected to make decisions independently by weighing many needs and priorities. The role and its surrounding organization aren't rigidly defined, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment. We are a lean team and are constantly managing new business challenges and learning on the job. We are looking for mission-driven teammates who can jump into any situation with enthusiasm.

item.title: Channel Partner Manager - Canada
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir Technologies’ seeks a Channel Partner Manager to help build and manage strategic relationships with Global System Integrators, Cloud Solution Providers (CSPs), and Value Added Resellers (VARs) in Canada.
As the Channel Partner Manager for Canada, you will help partners drive business using Palantir software products and will act as a trusted advisor in the journey of identifying new opportunities, developing capabilities, solutions and service offerings along with our partners. You will also be responsible for partnerships related to the social benefit our software solutions provide to Canadian communities.
In this role, you will define and implement business development strategies with global and local partners across the entire range of Palantir products and services. You’ll define the solution strategy, work with cross-functional teams, foster critical relationships within the partner ecosystems and showcase Palantir’s technology to our partners and customers.
Additionally, you’ll partner with Sales, Product, Legal, Compliance and Enablement teams to ensure success of the channel and will work to leverage your experience to transform large organizations with Palantir Technologies.

item.title: Capture Designer, US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Capture Designer, you will join our rapidly growing sales and marketing team, focused on winning business across our USG Civil portfolio. Being the first in this position, you'll play a diverse set of roles, from developing prototypes to defining how we tell our story as a company alongside our demand generation, sales, marketing, product, and leadership functions.
On a given day, you might be leading a design sprint for an urgent demo; designing a micro-interaction to make a complex analytical task feel simple; and/or advocating for product investment to support product-market fit.
Our team has people from a variety of backgrounds—people who studied type design, computer science, psychology; people who joined Palantir right after university; and people who joined our team after switching industries. We value skills and mindset over a specific educational background.

item.title: Business Development Operations Analyst Internship
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Business Development Operations Analysts are the operational backbones behind a variety of internal and client-facing teams. As a Business Development Operations Analyst Intern you’ll drive projects forward, own their operational outcomes and find solutions if things go awry. You’ll demonstrate your strength in organization and innovate on ways to help the people you support be as productive and impactful as possible.
Our ideal candidate is innovative, collaborative, and can balance differing goals and viewpoints when identifying solutions You will be a part of a team of individuals who are just as passionate about supporting one another as they are about Palantir’s mission. We operate in a high accountability, high expectation environment where the goal is always to produce the best solution. Willingness to accept and respond to feedback are critical.

item.title: Business Development Operations Analyst - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As Business Development Operations Analysts supporting our US Government teams, we do more than just support our leaders; we track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, drive operational outcomes, and anticipate needs, allowing the team to focus on the problems they are best equipped to solve. This role requires a combination of operations, project management, process optimization, and execution skills.
In this role, you’ll demonstrate your strength in organization and innovate on ways to help the people you support be as productive and impactful as possible. You’re resourceful and can drive toward a solution if things go awry. Communication is one of your greatest strengths and you excel at constructing order out of ambiguity.
You will also be responsible for driving US Government projects forward and owning their operational outcomes. Our ideal candidate is innovative, collaborative, and can balance differing goals and viewpoints when identifying solutions You will be a part of a team of individuals who are just as passionate about supporting one another as they are about Palantir’s mission. We operate in a high accountability, high expectation environment where the goal is always to produce the best solution. Willingness to accept and respond to feedback are critical.

item.title: Business Development Operations Analyst - Internal Operations
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Business Development Operations Analyst focused on scaling our team, you’ll do more than just full cycle recruiting; you’ll also track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and implement structure and operational horsepower to help scale the impact of the Mission Ops team. This position requires a combination of full cycle recruiting, project management, process optimization, and execution skills.
In this role, you will be responsible for handling a variety of recruiting initiatives across our Mission Operations team. You leverage your strength in anticipating and understanding business staffing needs and come up with creative solutions to ensure the right people are landing in the right roles. You take ownership and step up when things go wrong; even if a problem or process is outside your area of expertise, you make the first move to fix it. Communication is one of your greatest strengths and you excel at coming up with creative solutions for the business and candidate.
You will also be responsible for driving projects forward and owning their outcomes, either via delegation or direct ownership. Our ideal candidate is innovative, collaborative, and capable of dealing with complex interpersonal dynamics. You will be a part of a team of dedicated individuals who are just as passionate about supporting one another as they are about Palantir’s mission. We operate in a high accountability, high expectation environment where the goal is always to produce the best solution. Willingness to accept and respond to feedback are essential.

We operate in a high accountability, high expectation environment where the goal is always to produce the best solution. Willingness to accept and respond to feedback are essential.

item.title: Business Development Operations Analyst - CPSO - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
As a Business Development Operations Analyst and Contract Program Security Officer (CPSO) for our US Government teams, you do more than just support our implementation; you track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, support contract security workflows, and anticipate needs to free up your team to focus their time and attention on the problems they are best equipped to solve. This position requires a combination of operations, project management, process optimization, execution, and industrial security skills.
In this role, you’ll leverage your strength in organization and thrive off of enabling the people you support to be as productive and impactful as possible. You maintain accuracy and flexibility when completing any given task and are committed to seeing every project through to its completion. You take ownership and step up when things go awry; even if a problem is outside your area of expertise, you make the first move to fix it. Communication is one of your greatest strengths and you excel at constructing order out of ambiguity.
You will also be responsible for driving US Government projects forward and owning their operational outcomes, inclusive of ensuring our resources have the requisite clearances and security paperwork in place to be successful. Our ideal candidate is innovative, collaborative, and capable of dealing with complex interpersonal dynamics. You will be a part of a team of talented individuals who are just as passionate about supporting one another as they are about Palantir’s mission. We operate in a high accountability, high expectation environment where the goal is always to produce the best solution. Willingness to accept and respond to feedback is critical.

item.title: Atlassian Systems Engineer - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Atlassian Engineer at Palantir is responsible for owning and delivering complex solutions using the Jira application in a private cloud linux environment. You will be responsible for the upgrade, maintenance and customization of the Jira application and servers. As a member of the Collaboration Tools team, you will lead day-to-day projects, workflows, support requests, and partner closely with other internal teams to drive outcomes. Our ideal candidate will have experience supporting enterprise business processes and be solution-oriented, collaborative, and focused on outcomes.

item.title: Army Sales Lead
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
We're looking for a Sales Lead to support the continued growth of our US Government focused Sales team. As a key leader of the team, you will manage and expand the direct sales team, including Sales Executives and Account Executives, and grow our business across the Department of Defense.
This role is an exciting opportunity to drive mission-critical Sales & operations to help scale the business. You’ll be collaborating with stakeholders across US Government leadership, so to be successful you should have excellent relationship building skills and enjoy working in a dynamic, team-oriented environment.

item.title: Application Security Engineer
item.description:
Our Product Security team works on secure-by-design and deep product partnership. We build strong relationships with other teams and help them build secure software. This includes reviewing early-stage designs, helping develop threat models.
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Our products support some of the most important and impactful work in the world, including defense, intelligence, and commercial applications. We are trusted by our customers to protect their mission-critical information in the face of advanced persistent threats. The mission of the Application Security Team is to enable developers to be highly productive, agile, and produce the most secure software possible. Given the mission critical work that Palantir does, investments in application security have never been more important.
As an Application Security Engineer, you will be hands-on and have wide-ranging impact for the security of Palantir: • Product security reviews. You will perform full-scope security reviews of our current and future product and service portfolio. This includes whitebox, greybox, and blackbox assessments. You will work with offensive security teams, engineering teams, and other members of the InfoSec organization to harden our products against our dedicated adversaries. • Architecture and design. You will be the security subject matter expert for product architects and engineers. You will threat model, assess risks, and help implement security controls and mitigations to address identified issues. You will directly steer the design of our products to ensure we are secure-by-default. • Strategic security initiatives. You will be empowered to own transformational security initiatives that impact the whole company. Members of the Application Security Team have implemented software supply chain security controls (e.g., in-toto), implemented hardware-backed GPG key signing for commits, developed new security services, implemented security automation, or worked on massive-scale security problems. • Vulnerability identification and analysis. You will be responsible for finding new and novel ways to identify and resolve security vulnerabilities in our products. This includes static and dynamic code analysis, security scanning, investigation of security reports from InfoSec, our bug bounty program, or other trusted partners, and direct work with our incident response team on product security issues and incidents.
This role has wide-reaching impact, strong autonomy, and the resources and empowerment to make significant security improvements across all Palantir. The skills and background of successful candidates may vary highly, but curiosity, tenacity, and a drive to be a world-class security engineer are the underpinnings of our team.

You will perform full-scope security reviews of our current and future product and service portfolio. This includes whitebox, greybox, and blackbox assessments. You will work with offensive security teams, engineering teams, and other members of the InfoSec organization to harden our products against our dedicated adversaries. • Architecture and design. You will be the security subject matter expert for product architects and engineers. You will threat model, assess risks, and help implement security controls and mitigations to address identified issues. You will directly steer the design of our products to ensure we are secure-by-default. • Strategic security initiatives. You will be empowered to own transformational security initiatives that impact the whole company. Members of the Application Security Team have implemented software supply chain security controls (e.g., in-toto), implemented hardware-backed GPG key signing for commits, developed new security services, implemented security automation, or worked on massive-scale security problems. • Vulnerability identification and analysis. You will be responsible for finding new and novel ways to identify and resolve security vulnerabilities in our products. This includes static and dynamic code analysis, security scanning, investigation of security reports from InfoSec, our bug bounty program, or other trusted partners, and direct work with our incident response team on product security issues and incidents.
This role has wide-reaching impact, strong autonomy, and the resources and empowerment to make significant security improvements across all Palantir. The skills and background of successful candidates may vary highly, but curiosity, tenacity, and a drive to be a world-class security engineer are the underpinnings of our team.

item.title: Analyst Relations Specialist
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Note: This role does not work with Financial Analysts.
We're looking for an Analyst Relations Specialist to join a cross-functional team that's responsible for communicating Palantir's work and values. Analyst Relations is a strategic and highly visible function at Palantir, and we’re seeking a motivated communications specialist to join our team and work with the Head of AR and other internal SMEs in building out this new function for the company.
You'll have the opportunity to spearhead process improvement of operations related to Analyst Relations and articulate Palantir’s unique position in the market, value propositions, and key product differentiators. Our ideal candidate is collaborative by nature, adept at balancing multiple priorities and who exhibits strong interpersonal communications skills. This position requires project management and time management skills as well as a willingness to accept and respond to feedback.

item.title: Amplify Partner
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
What We're About
Amplify is Palantir’s enablement team and our mission is to help organizations harness the full potential of Foundry. We directly facilitate critical outcomes at the most important institutions in the world by helping our customers operationalize their data using Foundry. Tens of thousands of users rely on us every day to provide guidance on how to get the most out of Foundry. If you’re passionate about supercharging customer growth and building impactful models to support customers, we want to meet you.
What We Do
As an Amplify Partner you’ll work as part of a highly motivated and operationally-driven team, closely collaborate with Product Engineers, and work with Deployment Strategists in the field to identify opportunities for both our clients and Palantir. Our mission is to drive self-sufficiency amongst our clients, ensure they’re able to build momentum developing use cases in Foundry, and derive maximum business value from the Palantir partnership.
Amplify Partners are strategic and empathetic communicators who are able to manage client accounts and relationships. Our strengths include the ability to identify gaps in the product and internal operations, build effective and scalable solutions to address these gaps, and execute across a variety of responsibilities. We strive to create paths forward for our clients to ensure they’re supported in their digital transformation. We each own multiple client accounts, and if you join us you can expect to as well.

item.title: Alternate Facility Security Officer
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir's impact in the US Government (USG) space depends on our ability to navigate the world of government and industrial security efficiently and responsibly. We're looking for an Alternate Facility Security Officer (FSO) who can both arbitrate policy and processes around personnel and clearances, and partner with our business leaders to plan for the future in support of our Department of Defense (DoD) mission.
As a Alternate Facility Security Officer, you'll be part of our Government Security Team, which is responsible for managing our personnel clearance program and our secure facilities and systems. The Government Security Team ensures compliance with security policies, regulations and processes within complex organizations, while also enabling Palantir to get people and resources where they’re needed most. As a member of the team, you'll provide outstanding knowledge and customer service to the Palantirians who depend on you to help them push the business forward.
Our Alternate Facility Security Officers are tenacious, resourceful individuals who challenge conventional approaches to find innovative ways to navigate intricate bureaucracies. You'll flawlessly execute important processes to help us deliver outcomes to our customers faster while maintaining rigorous compliance with our customers' requirements.

item.title: Administrative Assistant
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Palantir Technologies' Proposal and Capture Strategy Team, and public sector sales and marketing functions, seek a versatile Administrative Assistant to support and execute on critical initiatives across the teams. As an Administrative Assistant, you will be involved in a range of centralized functions that support these teams, including but not limited to document administration, team-wide calendaring, event and in-office coordination, vendor management and targeted project assistance.
Throughout your work, you take initiative, operate with resourcefulness, and execute quickly and effectively. You enjoy helping others and can think three steps ahead to anticipate any additional needs. You are impeccably organized, excellent at time management, and extremely detail-oriented. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and are passionate about building trust with other members of the team through reliable and consistent bias towards action. Most importantly, you have a true desire to be helpful and go above and beyond to solve challenges.

Our Administrative Operations Team does more than just support our leaders: we’re the backbone of busy people at Palantir. We build strong relationships with the people we support and can anticipate their needs without being asked. Our passion for helping others makes us an invaluable resource.
As an Administrative Assistant, you will be responsible for navigating the intersection of an executive and a team’s business commitments. In this role, you thrive when providing administrative support and assisting team members because this enables your executive and team to reach their maximum productivity. You take initiative and operate with discretion and resourcefulness. Most importantly, you have a true desire to be useful and go above and beyond to solve challenges.
The position does require occasionally being on-call after hours or on weekends, but the person who accepts the challenge will enjoy a flexible schedule.

item.title: Accounts Receivable Specialist - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
The Finance Team supports and empowers Palantirians through both day-to-day operations and creative problem-solving. In this role you’ll be responsible for helping with the billing, collections, applications, and related reconciliation functions related to our US Government customers. You will be the a point of contact between customer Accounts Payable teams and internal Sales, Legal, and Finance teams responsible for early identification and resolution of billing or collection issues. As a member of our Finance team, you will be encouraged and empowered to innovate when something is broken. We are a fast growing, global organization and you will play a key role in expanding our processes to ensure a streamlined and compliant billing and collections process.

As an Accounts Payable Specialist, you are the operational engine behind Palantir’s Accounts Payable Team, a team that enables financial planning and analysis and helps inform business infrastructure. You’ll help maximize efficiency on various vendor payables workflows, including invoicing, contracts and agreements, as well as payments. An ideal candidate holds organization and attention to detail paramount and can drive alignment effectively between the relevant teams, both internal and external to Palantir to get things done.

item.title: Account Executive - US Government
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Account Executives are critical members of Palantir’s US Government team. Responsible for growing the business, they partner with business development and technical execution stakeholders to identify and win major opportunities. We’re looking for an Account Executive to expand Palantir’s footprint in the Department of Defense. By developing and executing strategy for new customer acquisition, this role will make an outsized impact on the organization’s growth trajectory.
Palantir is fast-paced, and in this role you'll be expected to make decisions independently by weighing many needs and priorities. The role and its surrounding organization aren't rigidly defined, so it's important that you can navigate an unstructured environment. We are a lean team and are constantly managing new business challenges and learning on the job. We are looking for mission-driven teammates who can jump into any situation with enthusiasm.

item.title: Account Director
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Around the world, data is being generated at an exponential rate, and many government agencies and commercial institutions worldwide are ill-equipped to handle data at scale. Palantir’s software helps these organizations build data assets that enables efficient analysis and more effective management of their data, empowering them to solve their most critical problems.
The Account Management Team is responsible for delivering Palantir’s software at these organizations. Account Directors find, evaluate, and pursue new business opportunities at Palantir’s strategic accounts, seeking growth that builds upon or expands beyond where we are today. Each institution is different and each customer has its own way of procuring software, Account Directors deeply understand these nuances and turn them into expansion opportunities. This takes creative thinking, diligent research, and a sharp focus on value creation. Successful Account Directors understand the needs of our customer, how they are currently leveraging Palantir, and have a clear plan to expand across the organization. They build relationships across the organization and are able to leverage these to increase the impact Palantir can have long term.
Armed with a deep knowledge of the product and its real-world applicability, Account Directors cultivate existing relationships within a specific account and work diligently to build new ones. Motivated by the knowledge that the software they sell has a myriad of different applications across verticals, they exceed ambitious sales quotas and come up with new targets.

The Account Management Team is responsible for delivering Palantir’s software at these organizations. Account Directors find, evaluate, and pursue new business opportunities at Palantir’s strategic accounts, seeking growth that builds upon or expands beyond where we are today. Each institution is different and each customer has its own way of procuring software, Account Directors deeply understand these nuances and turn them into expansion opportunities. This takes creative thinking, diligent research, and a sharp focus on value creation. Successful Account Directors understand the needs of our customer, how they are currently leveraging Palantir, and have a clear plan to expand across the organization. They build relationships across the organization and are able to leverage these to increase the impact Palantir can have long term.
Armed with a deep knowledge of the product and its real-world applicability, Account Directors cultivate existing relationships within a specific account and work diligently to build new ones. Motivated by the knowledge that the software they sell has a myriad of different applications across verticals, they exceed ambitious sales quotas and come up with new targets.

item.title: Account Director
item.description:
A World-Changing Company
At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.
The Role
Around the world, data is being generated at an exponential rate, and many government agencies and commercial institutions worldwide are ill-equipped to handle data at scale. Palantir’s software helps these organizations build data assets that enables efficient analysis and more effective management of their data, empowering them to solve their most critical problems.
The Account Management Team is responsible for delivering Palantir’s software at these organizations. They build relationships across the organization and are able to leverage these to increase the impact Palantir can have long term.

Motivated by the knowledge that the software they sell has a myriad of different applications across verticals, they exceed ambitious sales quotas and come up with new targets.
